verses.latin: Initium Evangelii Iesu Christi, Filii Dei.
verses.english: The beginning of the Gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

verses.latin: Sicut scriptum est in Isaia propheta: Ecce ego mitto angelum meum ante faciem tuam, qui praeparabit viam tuam ante te.
verses.english: Just as it is written in Isaiah the prophet: “Behold, I send my angel before your face, who will prepare your way before you.”

verses.latin: Vox clamantis in deserto: Parate viam Domini, rectas facite semitas eius.
verses.english: The voice of one crying in the desert: “Prepare the way of the Lord, make straight his paths.”

verses.latin: Fuit Ioannes in deserto baptizans, et praedicans baptismum paenitentiae in remissionem peccatorum.
verses.english: John was in the desert, baptizing and preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.

verses.latin: Et egrediebatur ad eum omnis terra Iudaeae, et Hierosolymitae universi, et baptizabantur ab eo in flumine Iordanis, confitentes peccata sua.
verses.english: And all the land of Judea and all the people of Jerusalem went out to him, and were baptized by him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins.

verses.latin: Et erat Ioannes vestitus pilis camelorum, et zona pellicia circa lumbos eius: et locustas et mel silvestre edebat.
verses.english: And John was clothed in camel’s hair and wore a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.

verses.latin: Et praedicabat dicens: Venit fortior me post me, cuius non sum dignus procumbens solvere corrigiam calciamentorum eius.
verses.english: And he preached, saying: “There comes after me the One who is mightier than I, the strap of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and loosen.”

verses.latin: Ego baptizavi vos in aqua: ille vero baptizabit vos in Spiritu Sancto.
verses.english: I have baptized you in water, but he will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.”

verses.latin: Et factum est in diebus illis, venit Iesus a Nazareth Galilaeae: et baptizatus est a Ioanne in Iordane.
verses.english: And it came to pass in those days that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.

verses.latin: Et statim ascendens de aqua, vidit apertos caelos, et Spiritum tamquam columbam descendentes et manentem in ipso.
verses.english: And immediately, coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens being torn open, and the Spirit descending upon him like a dove.

verses.latin: Et vox facta est de caelis: Tu es Filius meus dilectus, in te mihi complacui.
verses.english: And there came a voice from the heavens: “You are my beloved Son; in you I am well pleased.”

verses.latin: Et statim Spiritus expellit eum in desertum.
verses.english: And immediately the Spirit drove him out into the desert.

verses.latin: Et erat in deserto quadraginta diebus, et tentabatur a Satana: eratque cum bestiis, et angeli ministrabant illi.
verses.english: And he was in the desert forty days, being tempted by Satan; and he was with the beasts, and the angels ministered to him.

verses.latin: Postquam autem traditus est Ioannes, venit Iesus in Galilaeam praedicans Evangelium regni Dei,
verses.english: And after John was delivered up, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the Gospel of the kingdom of God,

verses.latin: et dicens: Quoniam impletum est tempus, et adpropinquavit regnum Dei: paenitemini, et credite Evangelio.
verses.english: and saying, “The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand; repent and believe in the Gospel.”

verses.latin: Et praeteriens iuxta mare Galilaeae, vidit Simonem, et Andream fratrem eius, mittentes retia in mare (erant enim piscatores).
verses.english: And passing along by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.

verses.latin: Et dixit eis Iesus: Venite post me, et faciam vos fieri piscatores hominum.
verses.english: And Jesus said to them: “Come after me, and I will make you become fishers of men.”

verses.latin: Et statim, relictis retibus, secuti sunt eum.
verses.english: And immediately they left their nets and followed him.

verses.latin: Et progressus inde pusillum, vidit Iacobum Zebedaei, et Ioannem fratrem eius, et ipsos in navi componentes retia:
verses.english: And going on a little further, he saw James the son of Zebedee and John his brother, who were also in the boat mending the nets.

verses.latin: et statim vocavit eos. Et relicto patre suo Zebedaeo in navi cum mercennariis, secuti sunt eum.
verses.english: And immediately he called them. And they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and followed him.

verses.latin: Et intrant in Capharnaum: et statim sabbatis, ingressus synagogam, docebat eos.
verses.english: And they went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath, he entered the synagogue and began to teach.

verses.latin: Et mirabantur super doctrina eius. Erat enim docens eos quasi potestatem habens, et non sicut scribae.
verses.english: And they were astonished at his teaching, for he taught them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.

verses.latin: Et statim erat in synagoga eorum homo in spiritu inmundo, et clamavit,
verses.english: And immediately there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit; and he cried out,

verses.latin: dicens: Quid nobis et tibi, Iesu Nazarene? Venisti perdere nos? Scio qui sis, Sanctus Dei.
verses.english: saying: “What have we to do with you, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are, the Holy One of God.”

verses.latin: Et comminatus est ei Iesus, dicens: Obmutesce, et exi de homine.
verses.english: And Jesus rebuked him, saying: “Be quiet, and come out of him.”

verses.latin: Et  e  convellens eum spiritus inmundus, et clamans voce magna, exiit ab eo.
verses.english: And the unclean spirit, convulsing him and crying with a loud voice, came out of him.

verses.latin: Et mirati sunt omnes, ita ut quaererent inter se dicentes: Quid est hoc? Quae est haec doctrina nova? Quia in potestate et spiritibus inmundis imperat, et obediunt ei.
verses.english: And they were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, saying: “What is this? A new teaching with authority! For he commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey him.”

verses.latin: Et  e  divulgata est fama eius statim per universam regionem Galilaeae.
verses.english: And at once his fame spread everywhere throughout all the region of Galilee.

verses.latin: Et protinus egredientes de synagoga, venerunt in domum Simonis et Andreae, cum Iacobo et Ioanne.
verses.english: And immediately, when they came out of the synagogue, they went into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.

verses.latin: Decumb  a  bat autem socrus Simonis in febre, et statim dixerunt ei de illa.
verses.english: Now Simon’s mother-in-law lay ill with a fever, and immediately they told him about her.

verses.latin: Et accedens elevavit eam, apprehensa manu eius: et continuo dimisit eam febris, et ministrabat eis.
verses.english: And he came and lifted her up, taking her by the hand; and immediately the fever left her, and she served them.

verses.latin: Vespere autem facto, cum sol occidisset, adferebant ad eum omnes male habentes, et daemonia habentes:
verses.english: And when evening had come, after the sun went down, they brought to him all who were sick or possessed with demons.

verses.latin: et erat omnis civitas congregata ad ianuam.
verses.english: And the whole city was gathered together at the door.

verses.latin: Et curavit multos, qui vexabantur variis languoribus, et daemonia multa eiecit: et non sinebat loqui daemonia, quoniam sciebant eum.
verses.english: And he healed many who were sick with various diseases, and cast out many demons; and he would not allow the demons to speak, because they knew him.

verses.latin: Et mane, adhuc nox erat, surgens, egressus abiit in desertum locum, et ibi orabat.
verses.english: And in the morning, rising up a great while before day, he went out and went to a lonely place, and there he prayed.

verses.latin: Et persecutus est eum Simon, et qui cum illo erant.
verses.english: And Simon and those who were with him followed him.

verses.latin: Et cum invenissent eum, dixerunt ei: Quia omnes quaerunt te.
verses.english: And when they found him, they said to him: “Everyone is looking for you.”

verses.latin: Et ait illis: Eamus in proximos vicos et civitates, ut et ibi praedicem: ideo enim exivi.
verses.english: And he said to them: “Let us go on to the next towns, that I may preach there also, for that is why I came out.”

verses.latin: Et venit praedicans in synagogis eorum, et daemonia eiciens.
verses.english: And he went throughout all Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and casting out demons.

verses.latin: Et venit ad eum leprosus, obsecrans eum: et genu flexo dixit ei: Si vis, potes me mundare.
verses.english: And a leper came to him, beseeching him, and kneeling said to him: “If you will, you can make me clean.”

verses.latin: Iesus autem misertus eius, extendens manum suam, tetigit eum, et ait illi: Volo: mundare.
verses.english: And Jesus, moved with pity, stretched out his hand and touched him and said to him, “I will; be clean.”

verses.latin: Et cum dixisset, statim discessit ab eo lepra, et mundatus est.
verses.english: And immediately the leprosy left him, and he was made clean.

verses.latin: Et comminatus ei statim, eiecit eum,
verses.english: And immediately he sternly warned him and sent him away,

verses.latin: et dicit ei: Vide, nemini dixeris: sed vade, ostende te sacerdoti, et offer pro emundatione tua quae praecepit Moyses in testimonium illis.
verses.english: and said to him: “See that you say nothing to anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing what Moses commanded, for a proof to them.”

verses.latin: At ille egressus, coepit praedicare et divulgare sermonem, ita ut iam non posset manifeste introire in civitatem, sed foris in desertis locis erat, et conveniobant ad eum undique.
verses.english: But he went out and began to proclaim it freely and to spread the word, so that Jesus could no longer openly enter a town, but was out in desolate places, and people were coming to him from every quarter.

verses.latin: Et iterum intravit Capharnaum post dies.
verses.english: Jesus returned to Capernaum a few days later.

verses.latin: Et auditum est quod in domo esset.
verses.english: The news spread that he was at home.

verses.latin: Et statim congregati sunt multi, ita ut non capiebant neque ante ostium, et loquebatur eis verbum.
verses.english: A crowd gathered, so many that there was no room left, not even near the door. Jesus began to preach the word of God to them.

verses.latin: Et venerunt ad eum ferentes paralyticum, qui a quatuor portabatur.
verses.english: Some men arrived, carrying a paralytic. The men carried him.

verses.latin: Et cum non possent offerre eum illi prae turba, nudaverunt tectum ubi erat: et effoderunt, et dimiserunt paralyticum, in quo iacebat.
verses.english: Because of the crowd, they couldn't bring him to Jesus. So, they uncovered the roof above where Jesus was and made an opening, then they lowered the man on his mat.

verses.latin: Videns autem Jesus fidem illorum, ait paralytico: Fili, dimittuntur tibi peccata tua.
verses.english: Seeing their faith, Jesus said to the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven.”

verses.latin: Erant autem illic quidam de scribis sedentes, et cogitantes in cordibus suis:
verses.english: Some scribes were sitting there, and they began to think to themselves:

verses.latin: Quid hic sic loquitur? blasphemat. Quis potest dimittere peccata, nisi solus Deus?
verses.english: “Why does this man speak like this? He's blaspheming! Who can forgive sins except God alone?”

verses.latin: Et statim cognoscens Jesus spiritu suo, quia sic cogitabant intra se, dicit illis: Quid ista cogitatis in cordibus vestris?
verses.english: Jesus, immediately aware in his spirit that they were thinking this, said to them, “Why are you thinking these things in your hearts?”

verses.latin: Quid est facilius, dicere paralytico: Dimittuntur tibi peccata tua: an dicere: Surge, tolle grabatum tuum, et ambula?
verses.english: “Which is easier: to tell the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up, pick up your mat, and walk’?”

verses.latin: Ut autem sciatis, quia Filius hominis potestatem habet in terra dimittendi peccata, (ait paralytico),
verses.english: “But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—He said to the paralytic,

verses.latin: Tibi dico, surge, tolle grabatum tuum, et vade in domum tuam.
verses.english: “I tell you, get up, pick up your mat, and go home.”

verses.latin: Et statim surrexit, et, levans grabatum, exiit coram omnibus: ita ut mirarentur omnes, et magnificarent Deum, dicentes: Quia numquam sic vidimus.
verses.english: He got up immediately, took his mat, and walked out in front of everyone. They were all amazed and praised God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this!”

verses.latin: Et egressus est iterum ad mare: omnisque turba veniebat ad eum, et docebat eos.
verses.english: Jesus went out again to the sea, and the whole crowd came to him, and he began to teach them.

verses.latin: Et praeteriens, vidit Levi, Alphei filium, sedentem ad teloneum: et ait illi: Sequere me. Et surgens, secutus est eum.
verses.english: As he was walking along, he saw Levi, son of Alphaeus, sitting at the tax booth, and he said to him, “Follow me.” And he got up and followed him.

verses.latin: Et factum est, cum ille recumberet in domo illius, multi publicani et peccatores simul discumbebant cum Jesu, et discipulis ejus: erant enim multi, qui et sequebantur eum.
verses.english: While Jesus was having dinner at Levi’s house, many tax collectors and sinners were eating with him and his disciples, for there were many who followed him.

verses.latin: Et scribae et pharisaei, videntes eum manducantem cum publicanis et peccatoribus, dicebant discipulis ejus: Quia cum publicanis et peccatoribus manducat et bibit?
verses.english: When the scribes and the Pharisees saw that he was eating with sinners and tax collectors, they said to his disciples, “Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?”

verses.latin: Et audiens Jesus, ait illis: Non necesse habent sani medicum, sed qui male habent: non veni vocare justos, sed peccatores.
verses.english: Hearing this, Jesus said to them, “Those who are well do not need a physician, but the sick do. I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”

verses.latin: Et erant discipuli Johannis et pharisaei jejunantes. Et veniunt, et dicunt illi: Quare discipuli Johannis et pharisaeorum jejunant: tui autem discipuli non jejunant?
verses.english: John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting. They came to Jesus and asked, “Why do John’s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples don’t fast?”

verses.latin: Et ait illis Jesus: Numquid possunt filii sponsi, dum sponsus cum illis est, jejunare?
verses.english: Jesus said to them, “Can the wedding guests fast while the bridegroom is with them?

verses.latin: Quamdiu habent sponsum secum, non possunt jejunare.
verses.english: As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.

verses.latin: Venient autem dies cum auferetur ab eis sponsus: et tunc jejunabunt in illis diebus.
verses.english: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and on that day they will fast.

verses.latin: Et nemo assuit membrum panni rudis ad vestimentum vetus: alioquin aufert supplementum novum a vetere, et major scissura fit.
verses.english: “No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment. Otherwise, the new piece tears away from the old, and the tear becomes worse.

verses.latin: Et nemo mittit vinum novum in utres veteres: alioquin dirumpent vinum, utres, et vinum effundetur, et utres peribunt: sed novum vinum in utres novos mitti debet.
verses.english: And no one puts new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise, the wine will burst the skins, and both the wine and the skins will be ruined. Instead, new wine is to be put into new wineskins.”

verses.latin: Et factum est, quod cum sabbato ambularet per sata, discipuli ejus coeperunt gradientes vellere spicas.
verses.english: One Sabbath, as Jesus was walking through the grainfields, his disciples began to pick some heads of grain.

verses.latin: Et pharisaei dicebant ei: Ecce, quid faciunt sabbatis, quod non licet?
verses.english: The Pharisees said to him, “Look, why are they doing what is unlawful on the Sabbath?”

verses.latin: Et ait illis: Numquam legistis quid fecerit David, quando necessitatem habuit, et esuriit ipse, et qui cum eo erant?
verses.english: He answered them, “Have you never read what David did when he and his companions were hungry and in need?

verses.latin: quomodo intravit in domum Dei sub Abiathar principe sacerdotum, et panes propositionis comedit, quos non licebat manducare nisi sacerdotibus, et dedit et iis qui cum eo erant?
verses.english: He entered the house of God in the time of Abiathar the high priest and ate the consecrated bread, which is lawful only for the priests to eat, and he also gave some to his companions.”

verses.latin: Et iterum ingressus est in synagogam: et erat ibi homo habens manum aridam.
verses.english: Again, He entered the synagogue. And there was a man there whose hand was shriveled.

verses.latin: Et observabant eum si sabbatis curaret, ut accusarent eum.
verses.english: And they watched Him to see if He would heal on the Sabbath so that they could accuse Him.

verses.latin: Et ait homini habenti manum aridam: Surge in medium.
verses.english: And He said to the man with the shriveled hand, “Stand up in the middle.”

verses.latin: Et dicit eis: Licet sabbatis bene facere, an male? animam salvam facere, an perdere? At illi tacebant.
verses.english: And He said to them, “Is it lawful to do good on the Sabbath, or to do evil? To save a life, or to kill?” But they were silent.

verses.latin: Et circumspiciens eos cum ira, contristatus propter caecitatem cordis eorum, ait homini: Extende manum tuam. Et extendit: et restituta est manus eius.
verses.english: And looking around at them with anger, grieved by the hardness of their hearts, He said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” And he stretched it out; and his hand was restored.

verses.latin: Et exientes statim Pharisaei, cum Herodianis, consilium faciebant adversus eum quomodo eum perderent.
verses.english: And immediately the Pharisees, along with the Herodians, went out and began to conspire against Him, as to how they might destroy Him.

verses.latin: Et Jesus cum discipulis suis secessit ad mare: et multitudo magna a Galilaea et Judaea sequebatur eum,
verses.english: And Jesus withdrew with His disciples to the sea. And a large crowd from Galilee and Judea followed Him,

verses.latin: et ab Jerusalem, et ab Idumaea, et trans Jordanem: et qui circa Tyrum et Sidonem, magna multitudo, audientes quae faciebat, venerunt ad eum.
verses.english: and from Jerusalem, and from Idumea, and beyond the Jordan. And those near Tyre and Sidon, a great crowd, hearing all that He was doing, came to Him.

verses.latin: Et dixit discipulis suis ut navicula sibi deserviret propter turbam, ne compriment illum.
verses.english: And He told His disciples that a small boat should be ready for Him because of the crowd, lest they crush Him.

verses.latin: Multi enim sanabat, ita ut irruerent in eum ut illum tangerent, quotquot habebant plagas.
verses.english: For He healed many, so that all those who had afflictions were pressing Him in order to touch Him.

verses.latin: Et spiritus immundi, quando eum videbant, procidebant ei: et clamabant, dicentes: Quia tu es Filius Dei.
verses.english: And whenever the unclean spirits saw Him, they would fall down before Him and cry out, saying, “You are the Son of God!”

verses.latin: Et multum illis comminabatur ne manifestum eum facerent.
verses.english: And He sternly warned them not to make Him known.

verses.latin: Et ascendens in montem vocavit ad se quos voluit: et venerunt ad eum.
verses.english: And going up on the mountain, He called to Him those whom He Himself willed, and they came to Him.

verses.latin: Et fecit ut essent duodecim: et ut mitteret eos praedicare.
verses.english: And He appointed twelve, that they might be with Him and that He might send them out to preach,

verses.latin: Et dedit illis potestatem curandi infirma et eiciendi daemonia.
verses.english: and have authority to cast out demons.

verses.latin: Et imposuit Simon: et imposuit nomen Petro.
verses.english: And He appointed Simon, to whom He gave the name Peter;

verses.latin: Et Jacobum Zebedaei, et Joannem fratrem Jacobi: et imposuit eis nomina Boanerges, quod est, Filii tonitrui:
verses.english: and James the son of Zebedee, and John the brother of James, to whom He gave the name Boanerges, which is, Sons of Thunder;

verses.latin: et Andream, et Philippum, et Bartholomaeum, et Matthaeum, et Thomam, et Jacobum Alphaei, et Thaddaeum, et Simonem Cananaeum,
verses.english: and Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Zealot,

verses.latin: et Judam Scariotem, qui et tradidit eum.
verses.english: and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed Him.

verses.latin: Et veniunt ad domum: et concurrunt iterum turbae, ita ut non possent neque panem manducare.
verses.english: And He went home. And the crowd gathered again, so that they could not even eat a meal.

verses.latin: Et cum audissent sui, exierunt tenere eum: dicebant enim, Quoniam in furorem versus est.
verses.english: And when His family heard it, they went out to seize Him, for they were saying, “He is out of His mind.”

verses.latin: Et scribae, qui de Jerosolymis descenderant, dicebant: Quoniam Beelzebub habet, et quia in principe daemoniorum eicit daemonia.
verses.english: And the scribes who came down from Jerusalem were saying, “He has Beelzebul,” and, “By the prince of demons He casts out demons.”

verses.latin: Et convocatis eis, in parabolis dicebat illis: Quomodo potest Satanas Satanam eicere?
verses.english: And He called them to Himself and began to speak to them in parables: “How can Satan cast out Satan?

verses.latin: Et si regnum divisum fuerit contra se, non potest stare regnum illud.
verses.english: And if a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

verses.latin: Et si domusdivisa fuerit contra se, non poterit domus illa stare.
verses.english: And if a house is divided against itself, that house will not be able to stand.

verses.latin: Et si Satanas consurrexit contra se, divisus est, et non potest stare, sed finem habet.
verses.english: And if Satan has risen up against himself and is divided, he cannot stand, but has an end.

verses.latin: Nemo potest vasa fortis ingressus in domum illius diripere, nisi prius fortem alligaverit: et tunc domum illius diripiet.
verses.english: But no one can enter a strong man's house and plunder his goods unless he first binds the strong man, and then he will plunder his house.

verses.latin: Amen dico vobis, quia omnia dimittentur filiis hominum peccata, et blasphemiae quibus blasphemaverint:
verses.english: “Truly, I say to you, all sins will be forgiven the sons of men, and whatever blasphemies they utter,

verses.latin: sed qui blasphemaverit in Spiritum Sanctum, non habet remissionem in aeternum, sed reus est aeterni delicti.
verses.english: but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is guilty of an eternal sin.”

verses.latin: Quia dicebant: Spiritum immundum habet.
verses.english: For they were saying, “He has an unclean spirit.”

verses.latin: Et veniunt mater ejus et fratres: et foris stantes miserunt ad eum, vocantes eum.
verses.english: And His mother and His brothers came, and standing outside, they sent to Him, calling Him.

verses.latin: Et sedebat circa eum turba: et dicunt ei: Ecce mater tua et fratres tui foris quaerunt te.
verses.english: And a crowd was sitting around Him, and they said to Him, “Your mother and Your brothers are outside, seeking You.”

verses.latin: Et respondens eis, ait: Quae est mater mea, et fratres mei?
verses.english: And answering them, He said, “Who is My mother, and who are My brothers?”

verses.latin: Et circumspiciens eos, qui in circuitu ejus sedebant, ait: Ecce mater mea et fratres mei.
verses.english: And looking around at those who sat around Him, He said, “Here are My mother and My brothers!

verses.latin: Qui enim fecerit voluntatem Dei, hic frater meus, et soror mea, et mater est.
verses.english: For whoever does the will of God, he is My brother and sister and mother.”

verses.latin: Et iterum coepit docere ad mare: et congregata est ad eum turba multa, ita ut in naviculam ascendens sederet in mari: et omnis turba circa mare erat supra terram.
verses.english: And again, He began to teach by the sea. And a great crowd gathered around Him, so that He entered a boat and sat on the sea. And all the crowd was on the land near the sea.

verses.latin: Et docebat eos in parabolis multa, et dicebat illis in doctrina sua:
verses.english: And He taught them many things in parables, and said to them in His teaching:

verses.latin: Audite: ecce exiit seminator seminare.
verses.english: Listen: behold, a sower went out to sow.

verses.latin: Et dum seminat, aliud cecidit secus viam, et venerunt volucres caeli, et comederunt illud.
verses.english: And as he sowed, some seed fell by the wayside, and the birds of the sky came and ate it up.

verses.latin: Aliud vero cecidit super petrosa, ubi non habuit multam terram: et statim exortum est, quia non habebat altitudinem terrae.
verses.english: And some fell upon stony ground where it did not have much earth, and immediately it sprang up because it had no depth of earth.

verses.latin: Et ubi ortus est sol, exuruit, et quia non habebat radicem, aruit.
verses.english: And when the sun rose, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered.

verses.latin: Et aliud cecidit in spinas: et ascenderunt spinae, et suffocaverunt illud, et fructum non dedit.
verses.english: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns sprang up and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.

verses.latin: Et aliud cecidit in terram bonam: et dabat fructum ascendentem et crescere, et unum triginta, et unum sexaginta, et unum centum.
verses.english: And some fell on good ground and yielded fruit that sprang up and increased, and produced, some thirtyfold, some sixtyfold, and some a hundredfold.

verses.latin: Et dicebat: Qui habet aures audiendi, audiat.
verses.english: And He said, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”

verses.latin: Et cum esset singularis, interrogabant eum qui cum eo erant, cum duodecim, parabolam.
verses.english: And when He was alone, those around Him with the twelve asked Him about the parable.

verses.latin: Et dicebat eis: Vobis datum est nosse mysterium regni Dei: illis autem, qui foris sunt, in parabolis omnia fiunt:
verses.english: And He said to them, “To you has been given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God, but to those who are outside, all things are done in parables,

verses.latin: ut videntes videant, et non videant, et audientes audiant, et non intelligant: ne quando convertantur, et dimittantur eis peccata.
verses.english: so that seeing they may see and not perceive, and hearing they may hear and not understand, lest they should turn and their sins be forgiven them.”

verses.latin: Et ait illis: Nescitis parabolam hanc? et quomodo omnes parabolas cognoscetis?
verses.english: And He said to them, “Do you not understand this parable? How then will you understand all the parables?

verses.latin: Qui seminat, verbum seminat.
verses.english: The sower sows the word.

verses.latin: Hi autem sunt, qui secus viam, ubi seminatur verbum, et statim veniunt Satanas, et aufert verbum, quod seminatum est in cordibus eorum.
verses.english: And these are the ones by the wayside, where the word is sown. And immediately Satan comes and takes away the word that was sown in their hearts.

verses.latin: Et hi sunt similiter, qui super petrosa seminantur: qui cum audierint verbum, statim cum gaudio accipiunt illud:
verses.english: And these are the ones sown on stony ground: who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with joy.

verses.latin: et non habent radicem in se, sed temporales sunt: deinde orta tribulatione et persecutione propter verbum, statim scandalizantur.
verses.english: And they have no root in themselves, but are temporary. Afterward, when tribulation or persecution arises because of the word, immediately they are scandalized.

verses.latin: Et alii sunt qui in spinas seminantur: hi sunt, qui verbum audiunt,
verses.english: And these are the ones sown among thorns: they are those who hear the word,

verses.latin: et curae saeculi, et deceptio divitiarum, et circa reliqua concupiscentiae introeunt, et suffocant verbum, et sine fructu efficitur.
verses.english: and the cares of the world, the deceitfulness of riches, and the desires for other things enter in and choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.

verses.latin: Et hi sunt, qui in terram bonam seminati sunt: qui audiunt verbum, et suscipiunt, et fructificant, unum triginta, et unum sexaginta, et unum centum.
verses.english: And those are the ones sown on good ground: who hear the word and receive it, and bear fruit, some thirtyfold, some sixtyfold, and some a hundredfold.”

verses.latin: Et dicebat illis: Numquid venit lucerna ut sub modio ponatur, aut sub lecto ponatur? nonne ut super candelabrum ponatur?
verses.english: And He said to them, “Does a lamp come to be put under a basket, or under a bed? Is it not to be put on a lampstand?

verses.latin: Non est enim aliquid absconditum, quod non manifestetur: nec factum est occultum, sed ut veniat in palam.
verses.english: For there is nothing hidden that will not be revealed, nor was anything made secret, but that it should come to light.

verses.latin: Si quis habet aures audiendi, audiat.
verses.english: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.”

verses.latin: Et dicebat illis: Videte quid audiatis. In qua mensura mensi fueritis, remetietur vobis, et addetur vobis.
verses.english: And He said to them, “Take heed what you hear. With whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you; and to you who hear, more will be added.

verses.latin: Qui enim habet, dabitur ei: et qui non habet, et quod habet auferetur ab eo.
verses.english: For whoever has, to him more will be given; and whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.”

verses.latin: Et dicebat: Sic est regnum Dei, quasi homo jaciat semen in terram,
verses.english: And He said, “The kingdom of God is like a man who casts seed on the earth,

verses.latin: et dormiat, et exsurgat nocte et die, et semen germinet, et increscat, nesciat ille.
verses.english: and sleeps and rises night and day, and the seed sprouts and grows, though he does not know how.

verses.latin: ultro enim terra fructificat: primum herbam, deinde spicam, deinde plenum frumentum in spica.
verses.english: For the earth bears fruit of itself: first the blade, then the head, and then the full grain in the head.

verses.latin: Et cum protulerit fructus, statim mittit falcem, quoniam venit messis.
verses.english: But when the grain is ripe, immediately he puts in the sickle, because the harvest has come.”

verses.latin: Et dicebat: Quomodo similesmus regnum Dei? aut in qua parabola narrabimus illud?
verses.english: And He said, “To what shall we compare the kingdom of God? Or with what parable will we present it?

verses.latin: Sicut granum sinapis, quod cum seminatum est in terra, minus est omnibus seminibus, quae sunt in terra:
verses.english: It is like a mustard seed which, when sown on the ground, is the smallest of all the seeds on earth;

verses.latin: et cum seminatum est, ascendit, et fit major omnibus oleribus, et facit ramos magnos, ita ut possint sub umbra ejus volucres caeli habitare.
verses.english: but when it is sown, it grows up and becomes greater than all herbs, and shoots out large branches, so that the birds of the sky can dwell under its shade.”

verses.latin: Et talibus parabolis loquebatur eis verbum, quatenus possent audire:
verses.english: And with many such parables, He spoke the word to them as they were able to hear it.

verses.latin: sine parabola autem non loquebatur eis: seorsum autem discipulis suis explicabat omnia.
verses.english: But without a parable, He did not speak to them. But privately to His own disciples, He explained everything.

verses.latin: Et cum sero factum esset, dicit eis: Transeamus contra.
verses.english: And on that day, when evening had come, He said to them, “Let us pass over to the other side.”

verses.latin: Et dimittentes turbam, assumunt eum ita in navi: et aliae naves erant cum illo.
verses.english: And leaving the crowd, they took Him along in the boat, and there were also other boats with Him.

verses.latin: Et facta est procella magna venti, et fluctus mittebant in navim, ita ut jam impleretur navis.
verses.english: And a great windstorm arose, and the waves were breaking into the boat, so that it was already filling.

verses.latin: Et ipse erat in puppi dormiens super cervical: et excitaverunt eum, et dicunt ei: Magister, nonne curas quod perimus?
verses.english: But He was in the stern, asleep on a cushion. And they awoke Him and said to Him, “Teacher, do you not care that we are perishing?”

verses.latin: Et exsurgens comminatus est vento, et dixit mari: Tace, obmutesce. Et cessavit ventus: et facta est tranquillitas magna.
verses.english: Then He arose and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, “Peace! Be still!” And the wind ceased and there was a great calm.

verses.latin: Et dixit eis: Quid timidi estis? nondum habetis fidem?
verses.english: And He said to them, “Why are you so fearful? How is it that you have no faith?”

verses.latin: Et timuerunt timore magno: et dicebant alter ad alterum: Quis putas hic est, quia et ventus et mare obediunt ei?
verses.english: And they feared exceedingly, and said to one another, “Who can this be, that even the wind and the sea obey Him?”

verses.latin: Et venerunt in mare, in regionem Gerasenorum. Et egressus statim de navi, occurrit ei de monumentis homo in spiritu immundo,
verses.english: They went to the sea in the territory of the Gerasenes. As soon as He disembarked from the boat, a man possessed by an evil spirit met Him there from the tombs,

verses.latin: qui habitationem habebat in monumentis, et iam neque catenis poterat quisquam eum ligare,
verses.english: The man lived in the tombs. No one could bind him anymore, not even with chains.

verses.latin: quia saepe compeditibus et catenis vinctus, dirumperet catenas et compedes confringeret, et nemo poterat eum domare.
verses.english: Often he had been bound with shackles and chains. But he would tear apart the chains and break the shackles, and no one could control him.

verses.latin: Et erat semper die ac nocte in monumentis et in montibus clamans, et seipsum scindens lapidibus.
verses.english: Day and night among the tombs and in the mountains, he was constantly shouting and cutting himself with stones.

verses.latin: Videns autem Jesum a longe, cucurrit et adoravit eum.
verses.english: Seeing Jesus from afar, he ran to Him and bowed down,

verses.latin: Et clamans voce magna, dixit: Quid mihi et tibi, Jesu fili Dei altissimi? Adjuro te per Deum, ne me torqueas.
verses.english: shouting in a loud voice, “What have You to do with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I implore You by God, do not torment me.”

verses.latin: Dicebat enim illi: Exi spiritus immunde ab homine.
verses.english: Jesus was already saying to him, “Come out, unclean spirit, from this man.”

verses.latin: Et interrogabat eum: Quod tibi nomen est? Et dixit: Legio nomen mihi est, quia multi sumus.
verses.english: Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” He replied, “My name is Legion, for we are many.”

verses.latin: Et rogabat eum multum, ne se expelleret extra regionem.
verses.english: And he begged Jesus again and again not to send them out of the area.

verses.latin: Erat autem ibi grex porcorum magnus pascentium.
verses.english: A large herd of swine was feeding there on the hillside.

verses.latin: Et rogabant eum spiritus dicentes: Mitte nos in porcos, ut ingrediamur in eos.
verses.english: And the spirits begged Him, saying, “Send us into the swine so that we may enter them.”

verses.latin: Et statim Jesus permisit eis. Et exierunt spiritus immundi, et introierunt in porcos: et magno impetu grex praecipitatus est in mare ad duo milia, et suffocati sunt in mari.
verses.english: Jesus gave them permission, and the unclean spirits came out and entered the swine. The herd, about two thousand in number, rushed down the steep bank into the sea and were drowned there.

verses.latin: Qui autem pascebant eos, fugerunt, et nuntiaverunt in civitatem et in villas. Et exierunt videre quid esset factum.
verses.english: Those who were tending them ran off and reported it in the city and the surrounding countryside. People went out to see what had happened.

verses.latin: Et veniunt ad Jesum, et vident illum qui a daemonio vexabatur, sedentem, vestitum, et sanae mentis: et timuerunt.
verses.english: They came to Jesus and saw the man who had been possessed by the legion of demons sitting there, clothed and in his right mind, and they were afraid.

verses.latin: Et nuntiaverunt illis qui viderant, quemadmodum factum esset ad daemoniacum, et de porcis.
verses.english: Those who had seen what had happened told them the whole story about the demon-possessed man and the swine.

verses.latin: Et coeperunt rogare eum ut discederet de finibus eorum.
verses.english: Then they began to beg Jesus to leave their region.

verses.latin: Et cum ascensisset navim, coepit eum rogare qui a daemonio vexatus fuerat, ut esset cum eo.
verses.english: As Jesus was getting into the boat, the man who had been demon-possessed begged Him to go with him.

verses.latin: Et non permisit eum, sed dixit ei: Vade in domum tuam ad tuos, et annuntia illis quanta tibi Deus fecerit, et misertus sit tui.
verses.english: Jesus did not let him, but said to him, “Go home to your family and tell them how much the Lord has done for you, and how He has had mercy on you.”

verses.latin: Et abiit, et coepit praedicare in Decapoli quanta fecisset illi Jesus: et omnes mirabantur.
verses.english: So the man went away and began to proclaim in the Decapolis how much Jesus had done for him, and all those who heard it were amazed.

verses.latin: Et cumtransisset Jesus in navi rursum,transfretavit in aliam regionem: et congregata est turba magna circa eum, et erat secus mare.
verses.english: When Jesus had crossed over again in the boat to the other side, a large crowd gathered around Him, and He was by the sea.

verses.latin: Et venit unus de principibus synagogae, nomine Jairus: et videns eum, procidit ad pedes ejus,
verses.english: Then one of the synagogue officials, named Jairus, came to Jesus. Seeing Him, he fell at His feet,

verses.latin: et deprecabatur eum multum, dicens: Quoniam filia mea in extremis est, ut venias, et imponas ei manus, ut salva sit, et vivat.
verses.english: and begged Him repeatedly, saying, “My little daughter is at the point of death. Please come and put Your hands on her so that she may be healed and live.”

verses.latin: Et abiit cum illo, et sequebatur eum turba multa, et premebant eum.
verses.english: So Jesus went with him. A large crowd followed and pressed around Him.

verses.latin: Et mulier, quae erat in profluvio sanguinis annis duodecim,
verses.english: And a woman was there who had been suffering from a hemorrhage for twelve years.

verses.latin: et audierat de Jesu, venit in turba retro, et tetigit vestimentum ejus.
verses.english: She had heard about Jesus and came up behind Him in the crowd and touched His cloak,

verses.latin: Dicebat enim: Quia si tetigero tantum vestimentum ejus, salva ero.
verses.english: because she said, “If I just touch His clothes, I will be healed.”

verses.latin: Et confestim siccatus est fons sanguinis ejus: et sensit in corpore quod sanata esset a plaga.
verses.english: Immediately her flow of blood dried up, and she realized in her body that she was healed of her affliction.

verses.latin: Et statim Jesus cognoscens in semetipso virtutem quae exierat de eo, conversus ad turbam, dicebat: Quis tetigit vestimentum meum?
verses.english: At once Jesus realized that power had gone out from Him. He turned around in the crowd and said, “Who touched My clothes?”

verses.latin: Et dicebant ei discipuli sui: Vides turbam prementem te, et dicis: Quis me tetigit?
verses.english: His disciples said to Him, “You see the crowd pressing around You, and yet You ask, ‘Who touched Me?’

verses.latin: Et circumspiciebat videre eam quae hoc fecerat.
verses.english: But Jesus kept looking around to see who had done it.

verses.latin: Mulier autem timens et tremens, sciens quod facta est in ea, venit, et procidit ante eum, et dixit ei omnem veritatem.
verses.english: The woman, knowing what had happened to her, came with fear and trembling, and fell down before Him and told Him the whole truth.

verses.latin: Ille autem dixit ei: Filia, fides tua te salvam fecit: vade in pacem, et esto sana a plaga tua.
verses.english: He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has healed you. Go in peace and be free from your affliction.”

verses.latin: Adhuc eo loquente, veniunt a principe synagogae, dicentes: Quia filia tua mortua est: quid ultra vexas magistrum?
verses.english: While He was still speaking, some people came from the synagogue official’s house and said, “Your daughter is dead. Why bother the Teacher any more?”

verses.latin: Jesus autem statim audito verbo, quod dicebatur, ait principi synagogae: Noli timere, tantum crede.
verses.english: But Jesus overheard what they were saying and said to the synagogue official, “Do not be afraid; just believe.”

verses.latin: Et non permisit quemquam sequi se, nisi Petrum, et Jacobum, et Joannem fratrem Jacobi.
verses.english: He allowed no one to follow Him except Peter, James, and John the brother of James.

verses.latin: Et veniunt in domum principis synagogae: et videt tumultum, et flentes et ululantes multum.
verses.english: They came to the home of the synagogue official, and Jesus saw a commotion, with people weeping and wailing loudly.

verses.latin: Et ingressus, ait illis: Quid turbamini, et ploratis? Puella non est mortua, sed dormit.
verses.english: When He entered, He said to them, “Why are you making a commotion and weeping? The child is not dead but sleeping.”

verses.latin: Et irridebant eum. Ipse vero eiectis omnibus, assumpsit patrem et matrem puellae, et qui secum erant, et intrat ubi puella erat.
verses.english: And they laughed at Him. But He put them all out and took the child’s father and mother and those who were with Him and went in where the child was.

verses.latin: Et tenens manum puellae, ait illi: Talitha cumi, quod est interpretatum: Puella, tibi dico, surge.
verses.english: Taking her by the hand, He said to her, “Talitha koum,” which means, “Little girl, I say to you, get up!”

verses.latin: Et statim surrexit puella, et ambulabat: erat autem annorum duodecim: et expaverunt statim magno stupore.
verses.english: Immediately the girl got up and began to walk around (for she was twelve years old). And the people were utterly amazed.

verses.latin: Et praecepit illis vehementer, ne quis sciret: et dixit dari illi manducare.
verses.english: He gave them strict orders not to let anyone know about this, and told them to give her something to eat.

verses.latin: Et exiit inde, et venit in patriam suam: et sequebantur eum discipuli sui.
verses.english: Jesus left that place and returned to His home country. His disciples followed Him.

verses.latin: Et facto sabbato, coepit in synagoga docere: et multi audientes admirabantur in doctrina ejus, dicentes: Unde huic haec? et quae est ista sapientia, quae data est illi, et virtutes tales, quae per manus ejus fiunt?
verses.english: When the Sabbath arrived, He began teaching in the synagogue. Many people heard Him and were astonished by His teaching. They asked, “Where did He get these things? What is this wisdom given to Him? And what are these mighty works that are done by His hands?”

verses.latin: Nonne hic est faber, filius Mariae, frater Jacobi, et Joseph, et Judae, et Simonis? nonne et sorores ejus hic sunt nobiscum? Et scandalizabantur in eo.
verses.english: “Isn't this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and the brother of James, and Joseph, and Judas, and Simon? Aren’t His sisters here with us?” And they took offense at Him.

verses.latin: Et dicebat eis Jesus: Non est propheta sine honore, nisi in patria sua, et in cognatis suis, et in domo sua.
verses.english: Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, among his own relatives, and in his own house.”

verses.latin: Et non poterat ibi virtutem ullam facere, nisi paucos infirmos, inpositis manibus, curavit.
verses.english: And He could do no mighty works there, except that He laid His hands on a few sick people and healed them.

verses.latin: Et mirabatur propter incredulitatem illorum: et circuibat castella in circuitu, docens.
verses.english: And He marveled at their unbelief. Then He went around teaching in the surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Et convocavit duodecim: et coepit illos mittere binos, et dabat illis potestatem in spiritibus immundis,
verses.english: He called the Twelve to Him and began to send them out two by two, giving them authority over unclean spirits.

verses.latin: et praecepit eis, ne quid tollerent in via, nisi virgam tantum: non peram, non panem, neque in zona aes;
verses.english: He instructed them to take nothing for their journey except a staff: no bag, no bread, and no money in their belts.

verses.latin: sed calciatos sandaliis, et ne induerent duas tunicas.
verses.english: They were to wear sandals and not to put on two tunics.

verses.latin: Et dicebat eis: In quacunque domo intraveritis, illic manete donec exieritis inde.
verses.english: He said to them, “Wherever you enter a house, stay there until you leave that place.

verses.latin: Et quicumque vos non receperint, neque audierint vos: exeuntes inde, excutite pulverem de pedibus vestris in testimonium illis. Amen dico vobis, quod magis tolerabile erit Sodomorum et Gomorrhæorum in die judicii, quam illi.
verses.english: And if any place will not welcome you or listen to you, shake off the dust that is on your feet as a testimony against them when you leave. Truly, I say to you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah on the day of judgment than for that town.”

verses.latin: Et egressi praedicabant ut poenitentiam agerent.
verses.english: So they went out and preached that people should repent.

verses.latin: Et daemonia multa eiciebant, et ungebant oleo multos aegrotos, et sanabant.
verses.english: And they cast out many demons, and they anointed many who were sick with oil, and healed them.

verses.latin: Et audivit Herodes rex (manifestum enim factum est nomen ejus) et dicebat: Joannes Baptista a mortuis resurrexit, et propterea virtutes operantur in illo.
verses.english: King Herod heard about Him, for His name had become well-known. He was saying, “John the Baptist has been raised from the dead, and that is why these powers are at work in Him.”

verses.latin: Alii autem dicebant: Quia Elias est. Alii vero dicebant: Quia propheta est, sicut unus ex prophetis.
verses.english: Others said, “He is Elijah.” And others said, “He is a prophet, like one of the prophets.”

verses.latin: Quo audito Herodes, dicebat: Quem ego decollari jussi Joannem, hic est: ipse surrexit.
verses.english: But when Herod heard this, he said, “John, whom I beheaded, has been raised.”

verses.latin: Ipse enim Herodes misit, et comprehendit Joannem, et vinxit eum in carcere propter Herodiadem uxorem Philippi fratris sui, quia duxerat eam.
verses.english: For Herod himself had sent and arrested John, and had bound him in prison on account of Herodias, the wife of his brother Philip, because he had married her.

verses.latin: Dicebat enim Joannes Herodi: Non licet tibi habere uxorem fratris tui.
verses.english: For John had been saying to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother's wife.”

verses.latin: Herodias autem insidiabatur illi: et volebat illum occidere, et non poterat.
verses.english: And Herodias was angry with him and wanted to kill him, but she could not.

verses.latin: Herodes enim metuebat Joannem, sciens eum virum justum et sanctum: et custodiebat eum, et audito eo, multa faciebat, et libenter eum audiebat.
verses.english: For Herod feared John, knowing that he was a righteous and holy man, and he kept him safe. When he heard him, he was greatly perplexed, and yet he liked to listen to him.

verses.latin: Et cum dies opportunus venisset, Herodes natalis sui cenam fecit principibus, et tribunis, et primis Galilaeae.
verses.english: But when a convenient time came, Herod gave a banquet for his nobles and military commanders and the leading men of Galilee.

verses.latin: Et cum intravisset filia Herodiadis, et saltasset, et placuisset Herodi et his qui simul recumbebant, dixit rex puellae: Pete a me quod vis, et dabo tibi.
verses.english: When the daughter of Herodias came in and danced, she pleased Herod and those who were with him. And the king said to the girl, “Ask me for whatever you wish, and I will give it to you.”

verses.latin: Et juravit illi: Quia quodcumque petieris a me, dabo tibi, usque ad dimidium regni mei.
verses.english: And he swore an oath to her, “Whatever you ask me, I will give you, even up to half of my kingdom.”

verses.latin: Qua egressa, ait matri suae: Quid petam? At illa dixit: Caput Joannis Baptistae.
verses.english: She went out and said to her mother, “What shall I ask for?” And she said, “The head of John the Baptist.”

verses.latin: Et cum introisset statim cum festinatione ad regem, et petierat dicens: Volo ut protinus mihi des in disco caput Joannis Baptistae.
verses.english: And immediately she came in a hurry to the king and asked, saying, “I want you to give me the head of John the Baptist on a platter right away.”

verses.latin: Et contristatus rex: propter juramentum, et propter eos qui simul recumbebant, noluit eam contristare.
verses.english: And the king was exceedingly sorry, but because of his oath and because of those who were with him, he did not want to break his word to her.

verses.latin: Statimque misit rex speculatorem, et praecepit afferri caput ejus. Qui iens decollavit eum in carcere,
verses.english: And immediately the king sent an executioner and commanded that John’s head be brought. So he went and beheaded him in the prison,

verses.latin: et attulit caput ejus in disco: et dedit illud puellae, et puella dedit matri suae.
verses.english: and brought his head on a platter and gave it to the girl, and the girl gave it to her mother.

verses.latin: Quo audito, discipuli ejus venerunt, et tulerunt corpus ejus, et posuerunt illud in monumento.
verses.english: When his disciples heard about it, they came and took his body and laid it in a tomb.

verses.latin: Et redeuntes Apostoli ad Jesum, renuntiaverunt ei omnia quae fecerant et docuerant.
verses.english: The apostles returned to Jesus and reported to Him all that they had done and taught.

verses.latin: Et ait illis: Venite seorsum in desertum locum, et requiescite pusillum. Erant enim qui veniebant et ibant multi: et nec manducandi spatium habebant.
verses.english: He said to them, “Come away by yourselves to a desolate place and rest a while.” For many were coming and going, and they had no leisure even to eat.

verses.latin: Et ascendentes in navim, abierunt in desertum locum seorsum.
verses.english: And they went away in the boat to a desolate place by themselves.

verses.latin: Et viderunt eos euntes, et cognoverunt multi: et pedestres currerunt illuc de omnibus civitatibus, et praevenerunt eos.
verses.english: Now many saw them going and recognized them, and they ran there on foot from all the towns and arrived ahead of them.

verses.latin: Et exiens Jesus, vidit turbam multam: et misertus est super eos, quia erant sicut oves non habentes pastorem: et coepit docere illos multa.
verses.english: When He went ashore, He saw a large crowd and had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. And He began to teach them many things.

verses.latin: Et jam hora multo praeteriit, accedentes discipuli ejus, dicunt ei: Desertus est locus, et jam hora praeteriit:
verses.english: And when it was already late, His disciples came to Him and said, “This is a desolate place, and it is already late.

verses.latin: Dimitte illos, ut euntes in proximas villas et vicos, emant sibi panes: non enim habent quid manducent.
verses.english: Send them away so that they may go into the surrounding countryside and villages and buy themselves something to eat, for they have nothing to eat.”

verses.latin: Et respondens, ait illis: Date illis vos manducare. Et dixerunt ei: Euntes, emamus denariis ducentis panes, et dabimus eis manducare?
verses.english: But He answered them, “You give them something to eat.” And they said to Him, “Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread and give them something to eat?”

verses.latin: Et dicit eis: Quot panes habetis? Ite et videte. Et cum cognovissent, dicunt: Quinque, et duos pisces.
verses.english: And He said to them, “How many loaves do you have? Go and see.” And when they had found out, they said, “Five, and two fish.”

verses.latin: Et praecepit illis ut facerent discumbere omnes secundum turmas super viride foenum.
verses.english: Then He commanded them all to sit down in groups on the green grass.

verses.latin: Et discubuerunt per centenos, et per quinquagenos.
verses.english: They reclined in companies of hundreds and of fifties.

verses.latin: Et acceptis quinque panibus et duobus piscibus, suspiciens in caelum, benedixit, et fregit panes, et dedit discipulis suis, ut ponerent ante eos: et duos pisces divisit omnibus.
verses.english: And taking the five loaves and the two fish, He looked up to the universe and blessed and broke the loaves. Then He gave them to the disciples to set before the people. And He divided the two fish among them all.

verses.latin: Et manducaverunt omnes, et saturati sunt.
verses.english: And they all ate and were satisfied.

verses.latin: Et sustulerunt fragmenta, duodecim cofini, et de piscibus.
verses.english: And they took up twelve baskets full of broken pieces and of the fish.

verses.latin: Et qui manducaverant, fuerunt quinque millia virorum.
verses.english: Those who ate the loaves were about five thousand men.

verses.latin: Et statim coegit discipulos suos ascendere in navim, et praecedere eum trans fretum ad Bethsaidam, dum ipse dimitteret populum.
verses.english: Immediately He made His disciples get into the boat and go ahead of Him to Bethsaida, while He sent the crowd away.

verses.latin: Et cum dimisisset eos, abiit in montem orare.
verses.english: And after He had taken leave of them, He went up on the mountain to pray.

verses.latin: Et cum sero esset, erat navis in medio mari, et ipse solus super terram.
verses.english: When evening came, the boat was out on the sea, and He was alone on the land.

verses.latin: Et videns illos laborantes in remigatione (erat enim ventus contrarius eis), et circa quartam vigiliam noctis venit ad eos, ambulans super mare: et volebat praeterire eos.
verses.english: And seeing that they were straining at the oars, for the wind was against them, He came to them in the fourth watch of the night, walking on the sea. He intended to pass by them.

verses.latin: At illi videntes eum ambulantem supra mare, putaverunt fantasma esse, et clamabant.
verses.english: But when they saw Him walking on the sea, they thought it was a ghost, and they cried out.

verses.latin: Omnes enim eum viderunt, et conturbati sunt. Et statim locutus est cum illis, et dixit eis: Confidite, ego sum, nolite timere.
verses.english: For they all saw Him and were terrified. But immediately He spoke with them and said to them, “Take heart; it is I. Do not be afraid.”

verses.latin: Et ascendit ad illos in navim, et cessavit ventus: et magis intra se stupebant:
verses.english: Then He got into the boat with them, and the wind ceased. And they were utterly astounded,

verses.latin: non enim intellexerant de panibus: erat enim cor illorum obcaecatum.
verses.english: because they had not understood about the loaves, but their hearts were hardened.

verses.latin: Et cum transfretassent, venerunt in terram Gennesareth, et applicuerunt.
verses.english: When they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret and moored to the shore.

verses.latin: Et cum egressi essent de navi, statim cognoverunt eum:
verses.english: And when they got out of the boat, immediately the people recognized Him

verses.latin: et currentes per totam regionem illam, coeperunt in lectis portare eos, qui se male habebant, ubicumque audiebant eum esse.
verses.english: and ran about the whole region and began to bring the sick people on their beds to where they heard He was.

verses.latin: Et quocumque introibat, in vicos, vel in villas, aut in civitates, in plateis ponebant infirmos, et deprecabantur eum, ut vel fimbriam vestimenti ejus tangerent: et quotquot tangebant eum, salvi fiebant.
verses.english: And wherever He went, into villages or cities or farms, they laid the sick in the marketplaces and begged Him that they might touch even the fringe of His garment. And as many as touched Him were made well.

verses.latin: Et conveniunt ad eum pharisæi et quidam de scribis, venientes ab Jerosolymis.
verses.english: Then the Pharisees and some scribes came together to see Him, having traveled from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et cum vidissent quosdam de discipulis ejus communibus manibus, id est non lavatis, panem manducare, reprehenderunt.
verses.english: And when they saw some of His disciples eating food with hands that were not washed—that is, common hands—they criticized them.

verses.latin: Pharisæi enim, et omnes Judæi, nisi crebro laverint manus, non manducant, tenentes traditionem seniorum:
verses.english: The Pharisees and all the Jews don't eat unless they wash their hands often, holding fast to the traditions of their elders:

verses.latin: et a foro, nisi aspergeantur, non comedunt: et alia multa sunt, quæ acceperunt tenere, lavationes calicum, et urceorum, et æris, et lectulorum.
verses.english: And after coming from the marketplace, they don't eat unless they wash first. There are many other traditions which they have received to keep, such as washing cups, jugs, bronze vessels, and beds.

verses.latin: Et interrogabant eum pharisæi et scribæ: Quare discipuli tui non ambulant juxta traditionem seniorum, sed communibus manibus panem manducant?
verses.english: Then the Pharisees and scribes questioned Him: “Why do Your disciples not live according to the traditions of the elders, but eat food with common hands?”

verses.latin: Qui respondens, dixit eis: Bene prophetavit Isaias de vobis hypocritis, sicut scriptum est: Populus hic labiis me honorat, cor autem eorum longe est a me.
verses.english: He responded by saying to them: “Isaiah prophesied correctly about you hypocrites, as it is written: ‘This people honors Me with their lips, but their heart is far from Me.’

verses.latin: In vanum autem colunt me, docentes doctrinas et præcepta hominum.
verses.english: ‘In vain they worship Me, teaching doctrines and precepts of men.’

verses.latin: Relinquentes enim mandatum Dei, tenetis traditionem hominum: lavationes urceorum et calicum: et alia similia multa facitis.
verses.english: ‘For, abandoning the commandment of God, you hold to the tradition of men: washing of jugs and cups, and many other similar things you do.’

verses.latin: Et dicebat eis: Bene irritum facitis præceptum Dei, ut traditionem vestram statuatis.
verses.english: And He said to them: “You do very well at making the commandment of God invalid, so that you can establish your own tradition.”

verses.latin: Moyses enim dixit: Honora patrem tuum et matrem tuam: et, Qui maledixerit patri, vel matri, morte moriatur.
verses.english: For Moses said: ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and ‘Whoever curses father or mother must surely die.’

verses.latin: Vos autem dicitis: Si dixerit homo patri, vel matri, Corban (quod est donum), quodcumque ex me profuerit tibi:
verses.english: But you say: ‘If a man says to his father or mother, “Corban” (which means, a gift), whatever profit you might have received from me,’

verses.latin: jam non permittitis eum quidquam facere patri suo, aut matri suæ,
verses.english: you no longer permit him to do anything for his father or his mother,

verses.latin: irritum facientes verbum Dei per traditionem vestram, quam tradidistis: et multa his similia facitis.
verses.english: making the word of God invalid through your tradition, which you have handed down. And you do many things similar to these.”

verses.latin: Et convocatis iterum turbis, dicebat eis: Audite me omnes, et intelligite.
verses.english: And, having called the crowd again, He said to them: “Listen to Me, all of you, and understand.

verses.latin: Nihil est extra hominem, quod intrinsecus in eum intret, quod possit eum coinquinare: sed quæ de homine procedunt, ea sunt quæ coinquinant hominem.
verses.english: There is nothing outside a man which, entering into him, can defile him; but the things which come out of the man, these are what defile the man.

verses.latin: Si quis habet aures audiendi, audiat.
verses.english: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.”

verses.latin: Et cum introisset in domum a turba, interrogabant eum discipuli ejus de parabola.
verses.english: And when He entered into the house away from the crowd, His disciples questioned Him about the parable.

verses.latin: Et ait illis: Sic et vos imprudentes estis? non intelligitis quia omne, quod deintrorsum in hominem intrat, non potest eum coinquinare?
verses.english: And He said to them: “Are you also as unintelligent? Don’t you understand that everything that enters a man from outside cannot defile him,

verses.latin: quia non intrat in cor ejus, sed in ventrem, et in secessum exit, purgans omnes escas?
verses.english: because it doesn’t enter his heart, but his stomach, and it goes out into the latrine, eliminating all the food?”

verses.latin: Dicebat autem, Quia quod de homine exit, illa coinquinant hominem.
verses.english: But He said, “What comes out of a man, that defiles the man.

verses.latin: Ab intus enim de corde hominum mala cogitationes procedunt, fornicationes, furta, homicidia,
verses.english: For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, acts of sexual immorality, thefts, murders,

verses.latin: adulteria, avaritiæ, malitiæ, dolus, impudicitia, oculus malus, blasphemia, superbia, stultitia.
verses.english: adulteries, acts of greed, wickedness, deceit, sensuality, envy, slander, arrogance, and foolishness.

verses.latin: Omnia hæc mala ab intus procedunt, et coinquinant hominem.
verses.english: All these evils proceed from within and defile the man.”

verses.latin: Et inde surgens abiit in fines Tyri et Sidonis: et ingressus domum, neminem volebat scire, et non potuit latere.
verses.english: Then, getting up, He went away to the area of Tyre and Sidon. And, entering a house, He didn’t want anyone to know, and yet He couldn’t remain hidden.

verses.latin: Mulier enim, cujus filia habebat spiritum immundum, statim ut audivit de eo, venit, et procidit ad pedes ejus.
verses.english: For a woman whose daughter had an unclean spirit, immediately after hearing about Him, came and fell at His feet.

verses.latin: Erat enim mulier gentilis, Syrophœnissa genere. Et rogabat eum ut eiceret dæmonium a filia sua.
verses.english: The woman was a Gentile, of Syrophoenician origin. And she begged Him to cast the demon out of her daughter.

verses.latin: Qui dicebat illi: Sine prius saturari filios: non est enim bonum sumere panem filiorum, et mittere canibus.
verses.english: He said to her, “Let the children be satisfied first, for it is not right to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”

verses.latin: At illa respondit: Domine, nam et canes sub mensa edunt de micis puerorum.
verses.english: But she responded, “Yes, Lord; but even the dogs under the table eat from the crumbs of the children.”

verses.latin: Et ait illi: Propter hoc verbum, vade: exiit dæmonium a filia tua.
verses.english: And He said to her: “Because of this word, go; the demon has gone out of your daughter.”

verses.latin: Et abiit in domum suam, et invenit puellam jacens super lectum, et dæmonium exiisse.
verses.english: And going home, she found the girl lying on the bed, and the demon had gone out.

verses.latin: Et iterum exiens de finibus Tyri, venit per Sidonem ad mare Galilææ, per medios fines Decapoleos.
verses.english: Then, departing again from the territory of Tyre, He came through Sidon to the Sea of Galilee, through the midst of the territory of the Decapolis.

verses.latin: Et adducunt ei surdum et mutum: et deprecabantur eum, ut imponeret illi manum.
verses.english: And they brought to Him a man who was deaf and mute. And they begged Him to place His hand on him.

verses.latin: Et apprehensum illum de turba, seorsum misit, et misit digitos suos in auriculas ejus: et exspuens, tangit linguam ejus:
verses.english: And, taking him away from the crowd privately, He put His fingers into his ears, and spitting, He touched his tongue.

verses.latin: et suspiciens in cælum, ingemuit, et ait illi: Ephpheta, quod est, Aperi te.
verses.english: Then, looking up to the sky, He groaned and said to him, “Ephphatha,” which means, “Be opened.”

verses.latin: Et statim apertæ sunt aures ejus, et solutus est vinculum linguæ ejus, et loquebatur recte.
verses.english: And immediately his ears were opened, and the bond of his tongue was loosened, and he was speaking correctly.

verses.latin: Et præcepit eis, ne cui dicerent. Quanto autem eis præcipiebat, tanto magis plus prædicabant:
verses.english: And He commanded them not to tell anyone. But as much as He commanded them, so much the more did they proclaim it:

verses.latin: et magis admirabantur, dicentes: Bene omnia fecit: et surdos facit audire, et mutos loqui.
verses.english: and they were exceedingly astonished, saying, “He has done all things well. He even makes the deaf to hear and the mute to speak!”

verses.latin: In illis diebus, cum turba multa esset, et non haberent quod manducarent, convocatis discipulis, ait illis:
verses.english: During those days, after a great crowd had gathered but didn't have anything to eat, Jesus summoned the disciples and told them:

verses.latin: Misereor super turbam: quia ecce jam tres dies sunt quod mecum perseverant, et non habent quod edant.
verses.english: “I have pity on the crowd because they’ve been with me for three days, and they don’t have anything to eat.

verses.latin: Et si dimisero eos jejunos in domum suam, deficient in via: sunt enim quidam ex eis de longe venerunt.
verses.english: If I send them away hungry to their homes, they will weaken on the way, because some of them have come from far away.”

verses.latin: Et responderunt ei discipuli sui: Unde illos poterit quis hic saturare panibus in solitudine?
verses.english: His disciples responded to him: “How can someone possibly feed them with bread here in the desert?”

verses.latin: Et interrogavit eos: Quot panes habetis? Qui dixerunt: Septem.
verses.english: Jesus then asked them: “How many loaves of bread do you have?” They replied: “Seven.”

verses.latin: Et praecepit turbæ discumbere super terram. Et accipiens septem panes, gratias agens, fregit, et dabat discipulis suis ut ponerent: et posuerunt turbæ.
verses.english: He ordered the crowd to recline on the ground. Then, taking the seven loaves, He gave thanks, broke them, and gave them to His disciples to set before the crowd. They did so.

verses.latin: Et habebant paucissimos pisciculos: et illos benedixit, et jussit illos poni.
verses.english: They also had a few small fish. Jesus blessed them and ordered that they be put before the crowd.

verses.latin: Et manducaverunt, et saturati sunt, et sustulerunt quod superaverat de fragmentis, septem sportas.
verses.english: Everyone ate and was satisfied. They collected what was left of the fragments—seven baskets full.

verses.latin: Erant autem qui manducaverunt, quasi quatuor millia: et dimisit eos.
verses.english: There were about four thousand people eating, and Jesus sent them away.

verses.latin: Et statim ascendens navim cum discipulis suis, venit in partes Dalmanutha.
verses.english: Immediately, He got into a boat with His disciples and went to the region of Dalmanutha.

verses.latin: Et exierunt Pharisaei, et coeperunt cum eo conquirere, quærentes ab eo signum de cælo, tentantes eum.
verses.english: Then the Pharisees came out and began to debate with Him, asking for a sign from the sky, testing Him.

verses.latin: Et ingemiscens spiritu suo, dicit: Quid generatio ista signum quærit? Amen dico vobis: Si dabitur generationi huic signum.
verses.english: He sighed deeply in His spirit, and said, “Why does this generation seek a sign? Truly I say to you, no sign will be given to this generation.”

verses.latin: Et dimittens eos, ascendit iterum navim, et abiit in aliam regionem.
verses.english: He left them, got back into the boat, and went to the other side of the lake.

verses.latin: Et obliti sunt panes sumere: et unum panem non tulerunt secum in navi.
verses.english: They had forgotten to bring bread. They had only one loaf with them in the boat.

verses.latin: Et præcepit eis, dicens: Videte, et cavete a fermento pharisæorum, et fermento Herodis.
verses.english: Jesus then commanded them, saying: “Watch out and beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod.”

verses.latin: Et cogitabant inter se, dicentes: Quia panes non habemus.
verses.english: They reasoned among themselves, saying: “It’s because we have no bread.”

verses.latin: Et cognoscens, ait illis: Quid cogitatis, quia panes non habetis? nondum cognoscitis neque intelligitis? adhuc cæcum habetis cor?
verses.english: Jesus, aware of this, said to them: “Why are you discussing that you have no bread? Don’t you yet understand or comprehend? Do you still have hardened hearts?

verses.latin: Oculos habentes, non videtis? et aures habentes, non auditis? nec recordamini?
verses.english: Do you have eyes but fail to see? Do you have ears but fail to hear? Don’t you remember?

verses.latin: Cum quinque panibus, quinque millia hominum, quot sportas fragmentorum levastis? Dicunt ei: Duodecim.
verses.english: When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many baskets of fragments did you gather?” They said to Him: “Twelve.”

verses.latin: Et cum septem panibus, quatuor millia, quot sportas fragmentorum levastis? Et dicunt ei: Septem.
verses.english: “And when I broke the seven loaves for the four thousand, how many baskets of fragments did you gather?” They said to Him: “Seven.”

verses.latin: Et dicebat eis: Quomodo nondum intelligitis?
verses.english: Then He said to them: “How is it that you still do not understand?”

verses.latin: Et veniunt Bethsaidam. Et adducunt ei cæcum, et rogabant eum ut illum tangeret.
verses.english: They came to Bethsaida. They brought a blind man to Jesus, and they begged Him to touch him.

verses.latin: Et apprehensa manu cæci, eduxit eum extra vicum: et exspuens in oculos ejus, impositis manibus, interrogavit eum si quid videret.
verses.english: Taking the blind man by the hand, He led him outside the village. Then, spitting on his eyes and laying His hands on him, He asked him if he saw anything.

verses.latin: Et respiciens, ait: Video homines, quasi arbores, ambulantes.
verses.english: The man looked up and said, “I see people, but they look like trees, walking around.”

verses.latin: Deinde iterum imposuit manus super oculos ejus, et coepit videre: et restitutus est, ita ut clare videret omnia.
verses.english: Then Jesus laid His hands on his eyes again, and he saw clearly, and his sight was restored. He could then see everything perfectly.

verses.latin: Et misit illum in domum suam, dicens: Vade in domum tuam: et si intra vicum ieris, ne dixeris alicui.
verses.english: Jesus sent him home, saying, “Do not go into the village.”

verses.latin: Et egressus est Jesus, et discipuli ejus, in castella Cæsareæ Philippi: et in via interrogabat discipulos suos, dicens eis: Quem me dicunt homines esse?
verses.english: Jesus and His disciples went to the villages of Caesarea Philippi. On the way, He asked His disciples, “Who do people say that I am?”

verses.latin: Qui dixerunt ei: Ioannem Baptistam: alii Eliam: alii vero unum de prophetis.
verses.english: They replied, “John the Baptist. Others say Elijah, and others say one of the prophets.”

verses.latin: Et dicit eis: Vos autem quem me dicitis esse? Respondens Petrus, ait ei: Tu es Christus.
verses.english: Then He asked them, “But who do *you* say that I am?” Peter answered, “You are the Christ.”

verses.latin: Et comminatus est eis, ne cui dicerent de eo.
verses.english: He strongly warned them not to tell anyone about Him.

verses.latin: Et coepit docere eos, quod oporteat Filium hominis multa pati, et reprobari a senioribus, et a principibus sacerdotum, et a scribis: et occidi: et post tres dies resurgere.
verses.english: Jesus then began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, the chief priests, and the scribes, and be killed, and then rise three days later.

verses.latin: Et palam verbum loquebatur. Et assumens Petrus eum, coepit increpare eum.
verses.english: He spoke openly about this. Peter took Him aside and began to rebuke Him.

verses.latin: Qui conversus, et videns discipulos suos, comminatus est Petro, dicens: Vade retro me, Satana: quoniam non sapis quæ Dei sunt, sed quæ hominum.
verses.english: But Jesus turned, and looking at His disciples, rebuked Peter and said, “Get behind me, Satan, because you are not thinking the things of God, but the things of men.”

verses.latin: Et convocata multitudine cum discipulis suis, dixit eis: Si quis vult me sequi, deneget semetipsum, et tollat crucem suam, et sequatur me.
verses.english: Then, calling the crowd to Himself along with His disciples, Jesus said to them: “If anyone wants to follow Me, let him deny himself, take up his cross, and follow Me.

verses.latin: Qui enim voluerit animam suam salvam facere, perdet eam: nam qui perdiderit animam suam propter me, et Evangelium, salvam faciet eam.
verses.english: For whoever wants to save his own life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for My sake and the Gospel will save it.

verses.latin: Quid enim prodest homini, si lucretur universum mundum, et detrimentum animæ suæ faciat?
verses.english: What does it profit a man to gain the whole world, yet forfeit his soul?

verses.latin: Aut quid dabit homo commutationis pro anima sua?
verses.english: Or what can a man give in exchange for his soul?

verses.latin: Qui enim me confusus fuerit, et verborum meorum in generatione ista adultera et peccatrice: et Filius hominis confundetur eum, cum venerit in gloria Patris sui cum angelis sanctis.
verses.english: If anyone is ashamed of Me and My words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will also be ashamed of him when He comes in the glory of His Father with the holy angels.

verses.latin: Et dicebat illis: Amen dico vobis, quoniam sunt quidam de hic stantibus, qui non gustabunt mortem, donec videant regnum Dei veniens in virtute.
verses.english: And He was telling them: “Truly, I say to you, some of those standing here will not experience death until they see the reign of God coming with power.”

verses.latin: Et post dies sex, assumit Jesus Petrum, et Jacobum, et Joannem: et ducit illos in montem excelsum seorsum solos, et transfiguratus est coram illis.
verses.english: And after six days, Jesus took Peter, and James, and John, and led them up to a high mountain apart by themselves, and He was transfigured before them.

verses.latin: Et vestimenta ejus facta sunt splendentia, nimis candida velut nix, qualia fullo non potest in terra candere.
verses.english: And His garments became shining, extremely white as snow, of a whiteness no fuller on earth can produce.

verses.latin: Et apparuit illis Elias cum Moyse: et erant loquentes cum Jesu.
verses.english: And Elijah appeared to them with Moses, and they were talking with Jesus.

verses.latin: Et respondens Petrus, ait Jesu: Rabbi, bonum est nos hic esse: et faciamus tria tabernacula, tibi unum, et Moysi unum, et Eliae unum.
verses.english: Then Peter responded, and said to Jesus: “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. So, let us build three tabernacles—one for You, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”

verses.latin: Nesciebat enim quid diceret: erant enim timore conpulsi.
verses.english: For he did not know what he was saying, because they were overcome with fear.

verses.latin: Et facta est nubes, obumbrans eos: et venit vox de nube, dicens: Hic est Filius meus dilectus: audite illum.
verses.english: And a cloud appeared, overshadowing them, and a voice came from the cloud, saying: “This is My beloved Son, hear Him.”

verses.latin: Et statim circumspicientes, amplius neminem viderunt, nisi solum Jesum cum ipsis.
verses.english: And immediately, looking around, they saw no one any more, except Jesus only with them.

verses.latin: Et descendentibus illis de monte, praecepit eis, ne alicui narrarent quae viderant, nisi cum Filius hominis a mortuis resurrexerit.
verses.english: And as they were coming down from the mountain, He commanded them not to tell anyone what they had seen, until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.

verses.latin: Et verbum retinuerunt apud se, interrogantes inter se quid esset, cum a mortuis resurgere.
verses.english: And they kept the word to themselves, questioning among themselves what this “rising from the dead” might be.

verses.latin: Et interrogabant eum, dicentes: Quid ergo dicunt pharisaei et scribae, quia Eliam oportet primum venire?
verses.english: And they questioned Him, saying: “Why then do the Pharisees and scribes say that Elijah must come first?”

verses.latin: Qui respondens, ait illis: Elias quidem cum venerit primum, restituet omnia: et quomodo scriptum est de Filio hominis, ut multa patiatur et contemnatur.
verses.english: Then He, answering, said to them: “Elijah does come first, and will restore all things. But how is it written concerning the Son of Man, that He must suffer many things and be despised?

verses.latin: Sed dico vobis, quia et Elias venit, et fecerunt illi quaecumque voluerunt, sicut scriptum est de eo.
verses.english: But I tell you, that Elijah has also come, and they did to him whatever they wished, just as it is written of him.”

verses.latin: Et venientes ad discipulos, viderunt magnam turbam circa eos, et scribas disputantes cum illis.
verses.english: And coming to the disciples, they saw a large crowd around them and scribes disputing with them.

verses.latin: Et statim omnis turba videns Jesum, stupefacti sunt: et accurrentes salutabant eum.
