verses.english: And immediately the whole crowd, seeing Jesus, were astonished, and running to Him, they greeted Him.

verses.latin: Et interrogavit eos: Quid disputatis ad invicem?
verses.english: And He asked them: “What are you disputing among yourselves?”

verses.latin: Et respondens unus de turba, dixit: Magister, attuli filium meum ad te, habentem spiritum inmundum.
verses.english: And one of the crowd responded, and said: “Teacher, I brought my son to You because he has an unclean spirit.

verses.latin: Et ubicumque eum adprehenderit, conrumpit eum, et lacerat: et spumat, et stridet dentibus, et arescit: et dixi discipulis tuis ut ejicerent illum, et non potuerunt.
verses.english: And wherever it seizes him, it throws him down, and he foams at the mouth, grinds his teeth, and becomes rigid. And I told Your disciples to cast it out, but they could not.”

verses.latin: Qui respondens, ait illis: O generatio incredula, quamdiu ero vobiscum? quamdiu vos patiar? adferte illum ad me.
verses.english: Then He answered them: “O faithless generation, how long will I be with you? How long will I put up with you? Bring him to Me.”

verses.latin: Et adtulerunt eum ad illum. Et cum vidisset eum, statim spiritus conturbavit eum: et corruens in terram, volvebatur spumans.
verses.english: And they brought him to Him. And as soon as the spirit saw Him, it immediately threw the boy into convulsions. And falling on the ground, he rolled around, foaming at the mouth.

verses.latin: Et interrogavit patrem ejus: Quantum temporis est ex quo ei hoc accidit? At ille ait: A puero.
verses.english: And He asked his father: “How long has this been happening to him?” And he said: “From childhood.

verses.latin: Et saepe illum in ignem, et in aquas misit, ut eum perderet. Sed si quid potes, adjuva nos, misertus super nos.
verses.english: And often it has thrown him into fire and into water, to destroy him. But if You can do anything, help us and have pity on us.”

verses.latin: Jesus autem ait illi: Si potes credere, omnia possibilia sunt credenti.
verses.english: Jesus said to him: “If you can believe, all things are possible to him who believes.”

verses.latin: Et continuo exclamans pater pueri, cum lacrimis aiebat: Credo, Domine: adjuva incredulitatem meam.
verses.english: And immediately the father of the boy cried out with tears, saying: “I believe, Lord. Help my unbelief.”

verses.latin: Et cum videret Jesus concurrentem turbam, comminatus est spiritui inmundo, dicens ei: Spiritus mutus et surdus, ego tibi praecipio, exi ab eo: et amplius ne introeas in eum.
verses.english: And when Jesus saw that the crowd was running together, He rebuked the unclean spirit, and said to it: “Mute and deaf spirit, I command you, come out of him, and never enter him again.”

verses.latin: Et clamans, et multum lacerans eum, exiit. Et factus est sicut mortuus, ita ut multi dicerent quod mortuus esset.
verses.english: And crying out and tearing him severely, it came out. And the boy became like a corpse, so that many said he was dead.

verses.latin: Jesus autem apprehendens manum ejus, elevavit eum: et surrexit.
verses.english: But Jesus, taking his hand, lifted him up, and he arose.

verses.latin: Et cum introisset in domum, discipuli ejus secreto interrogabant eum: Quare nos non potuimus ejicere eum?
verses.english: And when He had entered the house, His disciples asked Him privately: “Why could we not cast it out?”

verses.latin: Et dixit eis: Hoc genus in nullo potest exire, nisi in oratione et jejunio.
verses.english: And He said to them: “This kind can be cast out by nothing except by prayer and fasting.”

verses.latin: Et inde profecti, praetergrediebantur Galilaeam: et volebat neminem scire, quia docebat discipulos suos, et dicebat eis, Quia Filius hominis tradetur in manus hominum, et occident eum: et occisus, post tres dies resurget.
verses.english: And departing from there, they were passing through Galilee. And He did not want anyone to know, because He was teaching His disciples, and He was saying to them: “The Son of Man will be delivered into the hands of men, and they will kill Him; and being killed, after three days, He will rise.”

verses.latin: Qui nesciebant verbum: et timebant eum interrogare.
verses.english: But they did not understand the word, and they were afraid to ask Him.

verses.latin: Et venerunt Capharnaum. Et cum domum introissent, interrogabat eos: Quid in via cogitabatis?
verses.english: And they came to Capernaum. And when they had entered the house, He was asking them: “What were you arguing about on the way?”

verses.latin: At illi tacuerunt. Siquidem in via inter se disputaverant, quis eorum major esset.
verses.english: But they were silent, for on the way they had argued among themselves about who was the greatest.

verses.latin: Et sedens vocavit duodecim, et ait illis: Si quis vult primus esse, erit omnium novissimus, et omnium minister.
verses.english: And sitting down, He called the twelve, and said to them: “If anyone wishes to be first, he will be last of all and the servant of all.”

verses.latin: Et accepit puerum, et statuit eum in medio eorum: quem cum amplexatus esset, dixit eis:
verses.english: And taking a child, He set him in their midst, and embracing him, He said to them:

verses.latin: Quisquis unum ex talibus pueris susceperit in nomine meo, me suscipit: et quicumque me susceperit, non me suscipit, sed eum qui me misit.
verses.english: “Whoever receives one of these children in My name receives Me, and whoever receives Me, does not receive Me but Him who sent Me.”

verses.latin: Respondit illi Joannes, dicens: Magister, vidimus quendam in nomine tuo ejicientem daemonia, qui non sequitur nos, et prohibuimus eum.
verses.english: John answered Him, saying: “Teacher, we saw someone casting out demons in Your name, who does not follow us, and we forbade him.”

verses.latin: Jesus autem dixit: Nolite prohibere eum: nemo est enim qui faciat virtutem in nomine meo, et possit cito maledicere mihi.
verses.english: But Jesus said: “Do not forbid him, for there is no one who does a mighty work in My name, and can soon speak evil of Me.”

verses.latin: Qui enim non est contra nos, pro nobis est.
verses.english: For he who is not against us is for us.

verses.latin: Quicumque enim potum dederit vobis calicem aquae in nomine meo, quia Christi estis: amen dico vobis, non perdet mercedem suam.
verses.english: For whoever gives you a cup of water to drink in My name, because you are Christ’s, truly I say to you, he will not lose his reward.

verses.latin: Et qui scandalizaverit unum ex his pusillis, qui credunt in me: bonum est ei magis si circumdaretur mola asinaria collo ejus, et praecipitaretur in mare.
verses.english: And whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in Me to stumble, it would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were cast into the sea.

verses.latin: Et si scandalizaverit te manus tua, abscinde eam: bonum est tibi claudum intrare in vitam, quam duas manus habentem ire in gehennam, in ignem inextinguibilem,
verses.english: And if your hand causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life maimed, than to having two hands, go into hell, into the unquenchable fire,

verses.latin: ubi vermis eorum non moritur, et ignis non extinguitur.
verses.english: where their worm does not die, and the fire is not extinguished.

verses.latin: Et si pes tuus scandalizat te, abscinde eum: bonum est tibi claudum intrare in vitam aeternam, quam duos pedes habentem mitti in gehennam ignis inextinguibilis,
verses.english: And if your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into eternal life lame, than to having two feet, be cast into the hell of unquenchable fire,

verses.latin: ubi vermis eorum non moritur, et ignis non extinguitur.
verses.english: where their worm does not die, and the fire is not extinguished.

verses.latin: Et si oculus tuus scandalizat te, ejice eum: bonum est tibi luscum introire in regnum Dei, quam duos oculos habentem mitti in gehennam ignis,
verses.english: And if your eye causes you to stumble, cast it out. It is better for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye, than to having two eyes, be cast into the hell of fire,

verses.latin: ubi vermis eorum non moritur, et ignis non extinguitur.
verses.english: where their worm does not die, and the fire is not extinguished.

verses.latin: Omnis enim igne salietur: et omnis sacrificium sale condietur.
verses.english: For everyone will be salted with fire, and every sacrifice will be seasoned with salt.

verses.latin: Bonus est sal: quod si sal insulsum fuerit, in quo illud condietis?
verses.english: Salt is good, but if salt becomes tasteless, with what will you season it?

verses.latin: Habetis in vobis sal, et pacem habete inter vos.
verses.english: Have salt in yourselves, and keep peace among yourselves.”

verses.latin: Et inde surgens venit in fines Judææ ultra Jordanem: et conveniunt iterum turbæ ad eum, et de novo docebat eos.
verses.english: And then, He rose and went into the borders of Judea beyond the Jordan. Again, the crowds gathered to Him, and He was teaching them again.

verses.latin: Et accedentes pharisæi interrogaverunt eum: Si licet viro uxorem dimittere? tentantes eum.
verses.english: And the Pharisees approached Him and questioned Him: "Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife?" They were trying to trip Him up.

verses.latin: At ille respondens, dixit eis: Quid vobis mandavit Moyses?
verses.english: But He answering, said to them: "What did Moses command you?"

verses.latin: Qui dixerunt: Moyses permisit scribere libellum repudii, et dimittere.
verses.english: They said: "Moses allowed a man to write a bill of divorce and to put her away."

verses.latin: Quibus respondens Jesus, ait: Ad duritiam cordis vestri, scripsit vobis præceptum istud.
verses.english: To whom Jesus answering, said: "Because of the hardness of your hearts, he wrote you this commandment."

verses.latin: Ab initio autem creaturæ masculum et feminam fecit eos Deus.
verses.english: But from the beginning of creation, God made them male and female.

verses.latin: Propter hoc relinquet homo patrem suum, et matrem, et adherebit ad uxorem suam.
verses.english: For this cause, a man shall leave his father and mother, and cleave to his wife.

verses.latin: Et erunt duo in carne una. Itaque jam non sunt duo, sed una caro.
verses.english: And the two will be in one flesh. Therefore, they are no longer two, but one flesh.

verses.latin: Quod ergo Deus conjunxit, homo non separet.
verses.english: What God has joined together, let no man separate."

verses.latin: Et in domo iterum discipuli ejus de eadem re interrogaverunt eum.
verses.english: And in the house, the disciples again questioned Him about the same matter.

verses.latin: Et ait illis: Quicunque dimiserit uxorem suam, et aliam duxerit, mœchatur super eam.
verses.english: And He said to them: "Whoever puts away his wife, and marries another, commits adultery against her.

verses.latin: Et si uxor dimiserit virum suum, et alii nupserit, mœchatur.
verses.english: And if a woman puts away her husband, and is married to another, she commits adultery.

verses.latin: Et offerebant illi parvulos, ut tangeret illos. Discipuli autem increpabant offerentes.
verses.english: And they were bringing little children to Him, that He might touch them. But the disciples were rebuking those who were bringing them.

verses.latin: Quod cum videret Jesus, indigne tulit, et ait illis: Sinite parvulos venire ad me, et ne prohibueritis eos: talium est enim regnum Dei.
verses.english: When Jesus saw this, He was indignant, and said to them: "Allow the little children to come to Me, and do not forbid them: for of such is the kingdom of God.

verses.latin: Amen dico vobis, quicunque non receperit regnum Dei, sicut puer, non intrabit in illud.
verses.english: Amen I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God, as a child, will not enter into it."

verses.latin: Et amplexans eos, et imponens manus super illos, benedicebat eos.
verses.english: And embracing them, and imposing hands upon them, He blessed them.

verses.latin: Et egressus in viam, procurrens quidam genu flexo, interrogabat eum: Bone magister, quid faciam ut vitam æternam percipiam?
verses.english: And as He was going out into the way, a certain man, running up and kneeling to Him, was asking Him: "Good Master, what must I do that I may receive eternal life?"

verses.latin: Jesus autem dixit ei: Quid me dicis bonum? Nemo bonus, nisi unus Deus.
verses.english: And Jesus said to him: "Why do you call Me good? No one is good, but God alone.

verses.latin: Mandata nosti: Ne adulteres, ne occidas, ne fureis, ne falsum testimonium dicas, ne fraudem feceris, honora patrem tuum et matrem tuam.
verses.english: You know the commandments: 'Do not commit adultery. Do not kill. Do not steal. Do not bear false witness. Do not commit fraud. Honor your father and your mother.'

verses.latin: At ille respondens, ait illi: Magister, hæc omnia custodivi a juventute mea.
verses.english: But he answering, said to Him: "Master, I have kept all these things from my youth."

verses.latin: Jesus autem intuitus eum, amavit eum, et dixit illi: Unum tibi deest: vade, vende omnia quæcumque habes, et da pauperibus, et habebis thesaurum in cælo: et veni, sequere me.
verses.english: And Jesus looking upon him, loved him, and said to him: "One thing is lacking to you: go, sell all that you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven: and come, follow Me."

verses.latin: Qui contristatus in verbo, abiit mœrens: erat enim illi multa substantia.
verses.english: But he, being saddened by the word, went away sorrowful: for he had great possessions.

verses.latin: Et circumspiciens Jesus, dicit discipulis suis: Quam difficile, qui pecunias habent, in regnum Dei introibunt!
verses.english: And Jesus, looking around, said to His disciples: "How difficult it is for those who have riches to enter into the kingdom of God!"

verses.latin: Discipuli autem obstupescant in verbis ejus. Jesus autem iterum respondens, ait illis: Filioli, quam difficile est, confidentes in pecuniis, in regnum Dei introire!
verses.english: But the disciples were astonished at His words. But Jesus again answering, said to them: "Children, how difficult it is for those who trust in riches to enter into the kingdom of God!"

verses.latin: Facilius est camelum per foramen acus transire, quam divitem intrare in regnum Dei.
verses.english: It is easier for a camel to pass through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God."

verses.latin: Qui magis mirabantur, dicentes inter se: Et quis potest salvus fieri?
verses.english: And they were much more astonished, saying among themselves: "Who then can be saved?"

verses.latin: Intuens eos Jesus, ait: Apud homines impossibile est, sed non apud Deum: omnia enim possibilia sunt apud Deum.
verses.english: And Jesus, looking upon them, said: "With men it is impossible; but not with God. For all things are possible with God."

verses.latin: Et cœpit Petrus dicere illi: Ecce nos dimisimus omnia, et secuti sumus te.
verses.english: And Peter began to say to Him: "Behold, we have left all things, and have followed You."

verses.latin: Respondens Jesus, ait: Amen dico vobis, nemo est qui reliquit domum, aut fratres, aut sorores, aut patrem, aut matrem, aut filios, aut agros propter me, et propter Evangelium,
verses.english: Jesus answering, said: "Amen I say to you, there is no one who has left home, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or children, or lands, for My sake, and for the Gospel,

verses.latin: qui non accipiat centuplum nunc in hoc tempore, domos, et fratres, et sorores, et matres, et filios, et agros, cum persecutionibus, et in sæculo venturo vitam æternam.
verses.english: who will not receive a hundredfold now in this time, houses, and brothers, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and lands, with persecutions, and in the world to come life everlasting.

verses.latin: Multi autem primi erunt novissimi, et novissimi primi.
verses.english: But many that are first will be last, and the last will be first."

verses.latin: Erant autem in via ascendentes Jerosolymam: et præcedebat eos Jesus, et stupiebant: et sequentes timebant. Et assumpsit iterum duodecim, et cœpit illis dicere quæ ventura erant ei.
verses.english: And they were on the road, going up to Jerusalem: and Jesus was preceding them, and they were astonished: and those who followed were afraid. And taking the twelve again, He began to tell them the things that were to happen to Him.

verses.latin: Quia ecce ascendimus Jerosolymam, et Filius hominis tradetur principibus sacerdotum, et scribis, et damnabunt eum morte, et tradent eum gentibus:
verses.english: Saying: "Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be betrayed to the chief priests, and the scribes, and they will condemn Him to death, and will deliver Him to the Gentiles:

verses.latin: et illudent eum, et conspuent eum, et flagellabunt eum, et occident eum: et tertia die resurget.
verses.english: And they will mock Him, and spit upon Him, and scourge Him, and kill Him: and the third day He will rise again."

verses.latin: Et accedunt ad eum Jacobus et Joannes, filii Zebedæi, dicentes: Magister, volumus quodcumque petierimus, ut facias nobis.
verses.english: And James and John, the sons of Zebedee, approached Him, saying: "Master, we want You to do whatever we ask."

verses.latin: At ille dixit eis: Quid vultis faciam vobis?
verses.english: But He said to them: "What do you want Me to do for you?"

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: Da nobis, ut unus a dextris tuis, et alius a sinistris tuis sedeamus in gloria tua.
verses.english: And they said to Him: "Grant to us that one of us may sit at Your right hand, and the other at Your left, in Your glory."

verses.latin: Jesus autem dixit eis: Nescitis quid petatis. Potestis bibere calicem, quem ego bibo? aut baptismum quo ego baptizor, baptizari?
verses.english: But Jesus said to them: "You do not know what you are asking. Can you drink the chalice that I drink? Or be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?"

verses.latin: Qui dixerunt ei: Possumus. Et Jesus ait eis: Calicem quidem, quem ego bibo, bibetis: et baptismum quo ego baptizor, baptizabimini:
verses.english: They said to Him: "We can." And Jesus said to them: "The chalice indeed that I drink, you shall drink: and with the baptism that I am baptized, you shall be baptized.

verses.latin: sedere autem ad dextris meis vel sinistris, non est meum dare vobis, sed quibus paratum est.
verses.english: But to sit at My right hand or at My left is not Mine to give to you, but to those for whom it is prepared."

verses.latin: Et audientes decem, cœperunt indignari de Jacobo, et Joanne.
verses.english: And the ten hearing it, began to be indignant at James and John.

verses.latin: Jesus autem vocans eos, ait illis: Scitis quia qui videntur principari gentibus, dominantur eis: et magnates eorum potestatem exercent in eis.
verses.english: But Jesus calling them, said to them: "You know that those who are seen to rule over the Gentiles, lord it over them: and their great ones exercise power over them.

verses.latin: Non ita est autem in vobis: sed quicunque voluerit fieri major inter vos, erit vester minister:
verses.english: But it shall not be so among you: but whoever will become greater among you, will be your servant:

verses.latin: et quicunque voluerit inter vos primus esse, erit omnium servus.
verses.english: and whoever will want to be first among you, will be the servant of all.

verses.latin: Nam et Filius hominis non venit ministrari, sed ministrare, et dare animam suam redemptionem pro multis.
verses.english: For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life a redemption for many."

verses.latin: Et venerunt Jerichum. Et proficiscente eo de Jericho, et discipulis ejus, et turba multa, filius Timæi Bartimæus cæcus, sedebat juxta viam mendicans.
verses.english: And they came to Jericho. And as He was departing from Jericho, and with His disciples and a great multitude, Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the road.

verses.latin: Et cum audisset quia Jesus Nazarenus est, cœpit clamare, et dicere: Fili David, Jesu, miserere mei.
verses.english: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out and say: "Son of David, Jesus, have mercy on me."

verses.latin: Et multe increpabant eum, ut taceret: ille vero multo magis clamabat: Fili David, miserere mei.
verses.english: And many were rebuking him, that he should be quiet: but he cried out much more: "Son of David, have mercy on me."

verses.latin: Et stans Jesus, jussit illum vocari. Et vocant cæcum, dicentes ei: Confide: surge, vocat te.
verses.english: And Jesus standing, ordered him to be called. And they called the blind man, saying to him: "Have confidence: arise, He calls you."

verses.latin: Qui projiciens tunicam suam, exiliens venit ad eum.
verses.english: Who, casting off his garment, leaping up, came to Him.

verses.latin: Et respondens Jesus, dixit illi: Quid vis ut faciam tibi? Cæcus dixit ei: Rabboni, ut videam.
verses.english: And answering, Jesus said to him: "What do you want Me to do for you?" The blind man said to Him: "Rabboni, that I may see."

verses.latin: Et Jesus dixit ei: Vade, fides tua te salvum fecit. Et confestim vidit, et sequebatur eum in via.
verses.english: And Jesus said to him: "Go your way; your faith has made you safe." And immediately he saw and followed Him in the way.

verses.latin: Et cum appropinquarent Hierosolymis, et Bethaniam et Bethphage ad montem Olivarum, mittit duos discipulos suos,
verses.english: As He approached Jerusalem, and the towns of Bethany and Bethphage on the Mount of Olives, He sent two of His disciples,

verses.latin: et dicit eis: Ite in vicum qui contra vos est: et statim introëuntes eum, invenietis pullum ligatum, super quem nemo adhuc hominum sedit: solvite illum, et adducite.
verses.english: saying to them: “Go into the village which is in front of you. Entering into it right away, you will find a colt tied up. No one has ever ridden on it. Untie it, and bring it.”

verses.latin: Et si quis vobis dixerit: Quid facitis? dicite quia Dominus operam ejus desiderat: et confestim illum remittet huc.
verses.english: “If anyone asks you, ‘What are you doing?’ Say that the Lord has need of it, and He will send it back here immediately.”

verses.latin: Et abierunt, et invenerunt pullum ligatum ante januam foris in bivio, et solvunt eum.
verses.english: So they went off and found the colt tied up at a door outside, at a fork in the road, and they untied it.

verses.latin: Et quidam de illic stantibus dicebant illis: Quid facitis solventes pullum?
verses.english: Some of those standing there said to them: “What are you doing, untying the colt?”

verses.latin: Qui dixerunt eis sicut præceperat illis Jesus, et dimiserunt eos.
verses.english: They replied as Jesus had told them to, and they let them go.

verses.latin: Et adduxerunt pullum ad Jesum: et imposuerunt illi vestimenta sua, et sedit super eum.
verses.english: Then they brought the colt to Jesus. They put their cloaks on it, and He sat upon it.

verses.latin: Multi autem vestimenta sua straverunt in via: alii autem frondes cædebant de arboribus, et sternebant in via.
verses.english: And many people spread their cloaks on the road, while others cut down branches from the trees and scattered them on the road.

verses.latin: Et qui præcedebant, et qui sequebantur, clamabant, dicentes: Hosanna: Benedictus qui venit in nomine Domini.
verses.english: And those who went ahead and those who followed were shouting, saying: “Hosanna! Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord!”

verses.latin: Benedicta, quæ ventura est, regnum patris nostri David: Hosanna in excelsis.
verses.english: “Blessed is the kingdom of our father David, which is coming! Hosanna in the highest!”

verses.latin: Et intravit in Jerusalem, in templum: et circumspectis omnibus, cum jam vespera esset hora, exiit in Bethaniam cum duodecim.
verses.english: He entered into Jerusalem, and into the temple. And after looking around at everything, since it was already late in the day, He went out to Bethany with the twelve.

verses.latin: Et altera die cum exirent a Bethania, esuriit.
verses.english: On the next day, as they were leaving Bethany, He became hungry.

verses.latin: Et cum vidisset a longe ficum habentem folia, venit si quid forte inveniret in ea: et cum venit ad eam, nihil invenit præter folia: non enim erat tempus ficorum.
verses.english: Seeing in the distance a fig tree in leaf, He went to see if perhaps He could find anything on it. When He went up to it, He found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.

verses.latin: Et respondens dixit ei: Jam non amplius in æternum fructum ex te quisquam manducet. Et audiebant discipuli ejus.
verses.english: Then He said to it: “May no one ever eat fruit from you again.” And His disciples heard it.

verses.latin: Et veniunt in Jerusalem. Et ingressus Jesus in templum, cœpit ejicere vendentes et ementes in templo: et mensas nummulariorum, et cathedras vendentium columbas evertit,
verses.english: And they went to Jerusalem. And Jesus went into the temple and began to throw out those selling and buying in the temple. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the chairs of those selling doves.

verses.latin: et non sinebat ut quisquam vas transferret per templum.
verses.english: He would not allow anyone to carry anything through the temple.

verses.latin: Et docebat dicens eis: Nonne scriptum est: Quia domus mea domus orationis vocabitur omnibus gentibus? Vos autem fecistis eam speluncam latronum.
verses.english: And He taught them, saying to them: “Is it not written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations’? But you have made it a den of thieves.”

verses.latin: Quod cum audissent scribæ et principes sacerdotum, quærebant quomodo eum perderent: timebant enim eum, quoniam universus populus admirabatur in doctrina ejus.
verses.english: The scribes and chief priests heard this and began looking for a way to kill Him, for they were afraid of Him, because all the people were amazed by His teaching.

verses.latin: Et cum vespera facta esset, egrediebatur foras urbe.
verses.english: When evening came, He went out of the city.

verses.latin: Et cum mane transirent, viderunt ficum aridam factam a radicibus.
verses.english: And as they were passing by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered from the roots.

verses.latin: Et recordatus Petrus, dixit ei: Rabbi, ecce ficus quam maledixisti, aruit.
verses.english: Then Peter, remembering, said to Him: “Rabbi, look! The fig tree which you cursed has dried up.”

verses.latin: Et respondens Jesus, ait illis: Habete fidem Dei.
verses.english: And Jesus answered, saying to them: “Have faith in God.”

verses.latin: Amen dico vobis, quia qui dixerit huic monti: Tolle et mitte te in mare, et non hæsitaverit in corde suo, sed crediderit quia quodcumque dixerit fit, fiet ei.
verses.english: “Truly, I say to you, if anyone says to this mountain, ‘Be lifted up and thrown into the sea,’ and does not doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says will happen, it will be done for him.

verses.latin: Propterea dico vobis, omnia quæcumque orantes petitis, credite quia accipietis: et evenient vobis.
verses.english: “Therefore I tell you, whatever you pray and ask for, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours.

verses.latin: Et cum stabatis orantes, dimittite si quid habetis adversus aliquem, ut et Pater vester, qui in cælis est, dimittat vobis peccata vestra.
verses.english: “And whenever you stand praying, forgive anything you have against anyone, so that your Father in the universe may also forgive you your sins.”

verses.latin: Quod si vos non dimittitis, neque Pater vester qui in cælis est, dimittet vobis peccata vestra.
verses.english: “But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father who is in the universe forgive your sins.”

verses.latin: Et veniunt iterum in Jerusalem. Et cum ambularet in templo, accedunt ad eum principes sacerdotum, et scribæ, et seniores,
verses.english: And again they came to Jerusalem. And as He was walking in the temple, the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders came to Him,

verses.latin: et dicunt ei: In qua potestate hæc facis? et quis tibi dedit hanc potestatem ut hæc facias?
verses.english: and they were saying to Him: “By what authority are you doing these things? And who gave You this authority to do these things?”

verses.latin: Jesus autem respondens, ait illis: Interrogabo vos et ego unum verbum, et respondete mihi.
verses.english: Jesus answered them, “I will ask you one question, and if you answer Me, I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

verses.latin: Baptismum Joannis, de cælo erat, an ex hominibus? Respondete mihi.
verses.english: “Was the baptism of John from the universe, or from men? Answer Me.”

verses.latin: Et cogitabant intra se, dicentes: Si dixerimus, De cælo, dicet: Quare ergo non credidistis illi?
verses.english: And they were reasoning among themselves, saying: “If we say, ‘From the universe,’ He will say, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’”

verses.latin: Sed si dixerimus: Ex hominibus, timemus populum: omnes enim habebant Joannem quia vere propheta erat.
verses.english: “But if we say, ‘From men,’ we fear the people, for they all consider John to have been a true prophet.”

verses.latin: Et respondentes Jesu, dicunt: Nescimus. Et respondens Jesus, ait illis: Nec ego dico vobis in qua potestate hæc facio.
verses.english: So they answered Jesus, saying, “We do not know.” And Jesus answered them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”

verses.latin: Et coepit illis in parabolis loqui: Homo plantavit vineam, et circumdedit saepem, et fodit lacum, et ædificavit turrim, et locavit eam agricolis, et peregre profectus est.
verses.english: And He began to speak to them in parables: “A man planted a vineyard and put a fence around it, and dug a pit, and built a tower. Then he leased it to tenant farmers, and went away on a journey.

verses.latin: Et misit ad agricolas in tempore servum, ut ab agricolis acciperet de fructu vineæ.
verses.english: And when the harvest season came, he sent a servant to the farmers to collect the fruit of the vineyard.

verses.latin: Qui, adprehensum eum, ceciderunt: et dimiserunt vacuum.
verses.english: And seizing the servant, they beat him and sent him away empty-handed.

verses.latin: Et iterum misit ad illos alium servum: et illum capite vulnerantes, contumeliis affecerunt.
verses.english: And he sent to them again another servant, and him they wounded in the head, and treated shamefully.

verses.latin: Et misit alium: et illum occiderunt: et plures alios, quosdam cædentes, alios vero occidentes.
verses.english: Then he sent another one, and him they killed. And he sent many others, some of whom they beat, and some they killed.

verses.latin: Adhuc unum habens filium charissimum, misit illum ad illos novissimum, dicens: Quia reverebuntur filium meum.
verses.english: He still had one beloved son. Finally, he sent him to them, saying, ‘Surely they will respect my son.’

verses.latin: Illi autem agricolæ dixerunt ad alterutrum: Hic est hæres: venite, occidamus eum: et nostra erit hæreditas.
verses.english: But those farmers said to one another, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’

verses.latin: Et adprehendentes eum, occiderunt, et ejecerunt extra vineam.
verses.english: And seizing him, they killed him, and cast him out of the vineyard.

verses.latin: Quid ergo faciet dominus vineæ? Veniet, et perdet agricolas, et dabit vineam aliis.
verses.english: What therefore will the Lord of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.

verses.latin: Nec scripturam hanc legistis: Lapidem quem reprobaverunt ædificantes, hic factus est in caput anguli:
verses.english: Have you not read this scripture: ‘The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner.

verses.latin: A Domino factum est istud, et est mirabile in oculis nostris?
verses.english: This was done by the Lord, and it is wonderful in our eyes’?

verses.latin: Et quærebant eum comprehendere, et timuerunt turbas: cognoverant enim quoniam ad ipsos parabolam dixisset. Et relicto eo, abierunt.
verses.english: And they sought to seize Him, but they feared the crowds, for they knew that He had spoken the parable to them. And leaving Him, they went away.

verses.latin: Et mittunt ad eum quosdam ex Pharisæis et Herodianis, ut verbum ejus caperent.
verses.english: And they sent to Him some of the Pharisees and of the Herodians, to catch Him in His speech.

verses.latin: Qui cum venissent, dixerunt ei: Magister, scimus quia verax es, et non curas quemquam: nec enim vides in faciem hominum, sed in veritate viam Dei doces. Licetne dari tributum Cæsari, an non demus?
verses.english: And when they were come, they said to Him, “Teacher, we know that you are truthful and care for no one; for you do not regard the person of men, but teach the way of God in truth. Is it lawful to pay tribute to Caesar, or shall we not pay?”

verses.latin: Qui sciens versutiam illorum, ait illis: Quid me tentatis? Afferte mihi denarium ut videam.
verses.english: But He, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them, “Why are you tempting me? Bring me a denarius that I may see it.”

verses.latin: At illi attulerunt. Et ait illis: Cujus est imago hæc et superscriptio? Qui dixerunt ei: Cæsaris.
verses.english: And they brought it. And He said to them, “Whose is this image and inscription?” They said to Him, “Caesar’s.”

verses.latin: Respondens autem Jesus, dixit illis: Reddite igitur quæ Cæsaris sunt, Cæsari: et quæ Dei sunt, Deo. Et mirabantur super eo.
verses.english: And Jesus answering, said to them, “Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.” And they were astonished at Him.

verses.latin: Et venerunt ad eum Sadducæi, qui dicunt resurrectionem non esse: et interrogabant eum, dicentes:
verses.english: And there came to Him the Sadducees, who say that there is no resurrection; and they were questioning Him, saying:

verses.latin: Magister, Moyses scripsit nobis: Si cujus frater mortuus fuerit, et dimiserit uxorem, et non reliquerit filium, ut accipiat frater ejus uxorem fratris sui, et suscitet semen fratri suo.
verses.english: “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies and leaves a wife, and leaves no children, his brother should take the wife and raise up seed for his brother.

verses.latin: Septem fratres erant: et primus accepit uxorem, et mortuus est, non reliquit filium.
verses.english: There were seven brothers, and the first took a wife, and died without leaving children.

verses.latin: Et secundus accepit eam, et mortuus est, et nec hic reliquit illi filium. Et tertius similiter.
verses.english: And the second took her, and died, and neither did he leave children. And the third in like manner.

verses.latin: Et acceperunt eam septem: et non reliquerunt semen. Novissima omnium mulier mortua est.
verses.english: And the seven took her, and left no seed. Last of all, the woman died also.

verses.latin: In resurrectione ergo, cum resurrexerint, cujus de his erit uxor? septem enim habuerunt eam uxorem.
verses.english: In the resurrection, therefore, when they rise again, whose wife shall she be of them? For the seven had her as a wife.”

verses.latin: Respondens autem Jesus, dixit illis: Erratis, nescientes Scripturas, neque virtutem Dei.
verses.english: And Jesus answering, said to them, “You are mistaken, because you do not know the Scriptures, nor the power of God.

verses.latin: Nam cum a mortuis resurrexerint, neque nubent, neque nubentur, sed sunt sicut angeli in cælis.
verses.english: For when they rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like the angels in the heavens.

verses.latin: De mortuis autem quod resurgant, non legistis in libro Moysi, super rubo, quomodo dixit illi Deus, dicens:
verses.english: And as for the dead, that they rise again, have you not read in the book of Moses, in the passage about the bush, how God spoke to him, saying:

verses.latin: Ego sum Deus Abraham, et Deus Isaac, et Deus Jacob? Non est Deus mortuorum, sed vivorum. Ergo et vos multum erratis.
verses.english: ‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. Therefore, you are much mistaken.”

verses.latin: Et accessit unus de scribis, qui audierat illos disputantes, et videns quod bene illis respondisset, interrogavit eum: quodnam mandatum primum omnium est?
verses.english: And one of the scribes, who had heard them disputing, and seeing that He had answered them well, asked Him: “Which commandment is the first of all?”

verses.latin: Jesus autem respondit ei: Quod primum est: Audi, Israël: Dominus Deus noster, Dominus unus est:
verses.english: And Jesus answered him: “The first is: ‘Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one.

verses.latin: Et diliges Dominum Deum tuum ex toto corde tuo, et ex tota anima tua, et ex tota mente tua, et ex tota virtute tua. Hoc est primum mandatum.
verses.english: ‘And you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind, and with all your strength.’ This is the first commandment.

verses.latin: Et secundum est simile huic: Diliges proximum tuum sicut teipsum. Majus horum aliud mandatum non est.
verses.english: And the second is like this: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”

verses.latin: Et ait illi scriba: Bene, Magister, in veritate dixisti, quia unus est Deus, et non est alius præter eum:
verses.english: And the scribe said to Him: “Well, Teacher, you have spoken the truth, for there is one God, and there is no other but Him:

verses.latin: et diligere eum ex toto corde, et ex toto intellectu, et ex tota anima, et ex tota virtute, et diligere proximum tamquam seipsum, major est omnibus holocausis et sacrificiis.
verses.english: ‘And to love Him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, and with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love one’s neighbor as oneself, is greater than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.”

verses.latin: Jesus autem videns quod sapienter respondisset, dixit illi: Non es longe a regno Dei. Et nemo jam audebat eum interrogare.
verses.english: And Jesus, seeing that he had answered wisely, said to him: “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” And no one dared to question Him anymore.

verses.latin: Et respondens Jesus, dicebat docens in templo: Quomodo dicunt scribæ Christum filium David esse?
verses.english: And Jesus, answering, said, while teaching in the temple: “How do the scribes say that the Christ is the son of David?

verses.latin: Ipse enim David dixit in Spiritu Sancto: Dixit Dominus Domino meo: Sede a dextris meis, donec ponam inimicos tuos scabellum pedum tuorum.
verses.english: For David himself said in the Holy Spirit, ‘The Lord said to my Lord: Sit at My right hand, until I make Your enemies Your footstool.’

verses.latin: Ipse ergo David dicit eum Dominum: et unde est filius ejus?
verses.english: David himself calls Him ‘Lord.’ How is He then his son?”

verses.latin: Et multi turba audiebant eum libenter.
verses.english: And the great multitude listened to Him with pleasure.

verses.latin: Et dicebat eis in docendo suo: Cavete a scribis, qui volunt in stolis ambulare, et salutari in foro,
verses.english: And in His teaching He was saying: “Beware of the scribes, who wish to walk in long robes, and to be greeted in the marketplace,

verses.latin: et primas cathedras in synagogis, et primos discubitus in conviviis.
verses.english: and the chief seats in the synagogues, and the first places at feasts.

verses.latin: Qui devorant domos viduarum sub specie longa orationis: hi accipient prolixius judicium.
verses.english: They devour the houses of widows under the guise of long prayers. These will receive a more severe judgment.”

verses.latin: Et sedens Jesus contra gazophylacium, aspiciebat quomodo turba jactaret æra in gazophylacium: et multi divites multum jactabant.
verses.english: And Jesus sat down opposite the treasury, and watched how the crowd was casting money into the treasury. And many rich people were throwing in much.

verses.latin: Et veniens una vidua pauper, misit duas obolos, hoc est, quadrantem.
verses.english: And a poor widow came and put in two small copper coins, which make a farthing.

verses.latin: Et convocans discipulos suos, ait illis: Amen dico vobis, quoniam vidua hæc pauper plus misit quam omnes qui miserunt in gazophylacium.
verses.english: And calling His disciples to Him, He said to them: “Amen I say to you, that this poor widow has cast in more than all those who have cast into the treasury.

verses.latin: Omnes enim ex eo quod abundabat eis miserunt: hæc autem de penuria sua omnia, quæ habuit, misit.
verses.english: For they all put in out of their abundance; but she out of her poverty has put in all that she had, even her whole living.”

verses.latin: Et cum exisset de templo, ait illi unus ex discipulis ejus: Magister, aspice quales lapides et quales structurae!
verses.english: As He left the temple, one of His disciples said, “Teacher, look at the enormous stones and impressive buildings!”

verses.latin: Et respondens Jesus, dixit ei: Vides has omnes magnas aedificationes? Non relinquetur lapis super lapidem, qui non destruatur.
verses.english: Jesus answered, “Do you see these great buildings? Not a stone will be left upon a stone; all will be torn down.”

verses.latin: Et sedente eo in monte Oliveti contra templum, interrogabant eum separatim Petrus, et Jacobus, et Joannes, et Andreas:
verses.english: As He sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked Him privately:

verses.latin: Dic nobis quando ista erunt? et quod signum erit quando haec omnia incipient consummari?
verses.english: “Tell us, when will these things happen? And what sign will there be when all these things are about to be fulfilled?”

verses.latin: Et respondens Jesus coepit dicere eis: Videte ne quis vos seducat.
verses.english: Jesus began to say to them: “Be careful that no one deceives you.

verses.latin: Multi enim venient in nomine meo, dicentes: Ego sum: et multos seducent.
verses.english: For many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am He,’ and they will deceive many.

verses.latin: Cum audieritis autem bella, et opiniones bellorum, ne timueritis: oportet enim fieri, sed nondum finis.
verses.english: And when you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be alarmed; for such things must happen, but the end is not yet.

verses.latin: Exsurget enim gens contra gentem, et regnum adversus regnum: et erunt terraemotus per loca, et fames. Initium dolorum haec.
verses.english: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places, and famines. These are the beginning of birth pangs.

verses.latin: Vos autem videte vobismetipsis: tradent enim vos in conciliis, et in synagogis vapulabitis: et ante praesides et reges stetis propter me, in testimonium illis.
verses.english: “But be careful yourselves; for they will deliver you up to councils, and you will be beaten in synagogues. You will stand before governors and kings for My sake, for a testimony to them.

verses.latin: Et in omnes gentes oportet primum praedicari Evangelium.
verses.english: And the gospel must first be preached to all the nations.

verses.latin: Et cum duxerint vos tradentes, nolite praecogitare quid loquamini: sed quod datum vobis fuerit in illa hora, loquimini: non enim vos estis loquentes, sed Spiritus Sanctus.
verses.english: And when they deliver you and bring you to trial, do not worry beforehand about what you are to say, but say whatever is given you at that hour; for it is not you who speak, but the Holy Spirit.

verses.latin: Tradet autem frater fratrem in mortem, et pater filium: et consurgent filii in parentes, et morte eos afficient.
verses.english: And brother will deliver brother to death, and the father his child; and children will rise up against parents and cause them to be put to death.

verses.latin: Et eritis odio omnibus propter nomen meum: qui autem sustinuerit in finem, hic salvus erit.
verses.english: And you will be hated by everyone because of My name, but the one who perseveres to the end will be saved.

verses.latin: Cum autem videritis abominationem desolationis stantem ubi non debet (qui legit, intelligat): tunc qui in Judaea sunt, fugiant in montes:
verses.english: “But when you see the abomination of desolation standing where it should not be (let the reader understand), then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.

verses.latin: et qui in tecto, ne descendat in domum, nec introeat ut tollat quid de domo sua:
verses.english: Let the one who is on the housetop not go down, nor enter the house to take anything out.

verses.latin: et qui in agro, non revertatur retro tollere pallium suum.
verses.english: And let the one who is in the field not turn back to get his cloak.

verses.latin: Vae autem praegnantibus, et nutrientibus in illis diebus.
verses.english: “But woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing infants in those days!

verses.latin: Orate vero ut non fiant haec in hieme.
verses.english: Pray that it may not happen in the winter.

verses.latin: Erunt enim dies illi tribulationis, quales non fuerunt ab initio creaturae, quam creavit Deus, usque nunc, neque fient.
verses.english: “For those days will be a time of tribulation, such as has not occurred from the beginning of the creation which God created until now, and never will occur.

verses.latin: Et nisi breviasset Dominus dies illos, non fieret salva omnis caro: sed propter electos quos elegit, breviavit dies.
verses.english: “And unless the Lord shortened those days, no one would be saved; but for the sake of the elect, whom He chose, He shortened the days.

verses.latin: Et tunc si quis vobis dixerit: Ecce hic est Christus, ecce illic, nolite credere.
verses.english: “And then if anyone says to you, ‘Behold, here is the Christ,’ or, ‘Behold, He is there,’ do not believe it.

verses.latin: Exurgent enim pseudochristi et pseudoprophetae: et dabunt signa et prodigia ad seducendos, si fieri potest, etiam electos.
verses.english: For false Christs and false prophets will arise, and will show signs and wonders, in order to lead astray, if possible, the elect.

verses.latin: Vos ergo videte: ecce praedixi vobis omnia.
verses.english: “But be on your guard; I have told you everything beforehand.

verses.latin: Sed in illis diebus, post tribulationem illam, sol obscurabitur, et luna non dabit lumen suum:
verses.english: “But in those days, after that tribulation, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light,

verses.latin: et stellae caeli cadent, et virtutes quae in caelis sunt movebuntur.
verses.english: and the stars will be falling from heaven, and the powers that are in the heavens will be shaken.

verses.latin: Et tunc videbunt Filium hominis venientem in nubibus cum potestate multa et gloria.
verses.english: “And then they will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.

verses.latin: Et tunc mittet angelos suos, et congregabit electos suos a quattuor ventis, a summo terrae usque ad summum caeli.
verses.english: “And then He will send forth the angels, and will gather together His elect from the four winds, from the farthest end of the earth to the farthest end of heaven.

verses.latin: A ficu discite parabolam: cum jam ramus ejus tener fuerit, et folia nata fuerint, scitis quia in proximo est aestas:
verses.english: “Now learn the parable from the fig tree: when its branch has already become tender and puts forth its leaves, you know that summer is near.

verses.latin: ita et vos cum videritis haec fieri, scitote quod in proximo sunt in januis.
verses.english: “So also you, when you see these things happening, recognize that He is near, right at the doors.

verses.latin: Amen dico vobis, quoniam non praeteribit generatio haec, donec omnia ista fiant.
verses.english: “Truly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things take place.

verses.latin: Caelum et terra transibunt: verba autem mea non praeteribunt.
verses.english: “Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will not pass away.

verses.latin: De die autem illa, vel hora, nemo scit, neque angeli in caelo, neque Filius, nisi Pater.
verses.english: “But of that day or hour, no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but the Father.

verses.latin: Videte, vigilate et orate: nescitis enim quando tempus sit.
verses.english: “Be on the alert, keep awake, and pray; for you do not know when the time will come.

verses.latin: Sicut homo qui peregre profectus, reliquit domum suam, et dedit servis suis potestatem cujusque operis, et janitori praecepit ut vigilet:
verses.english: “It is like a man away on a journey, who upon leaving his house and putting his servants in charge, assigning to each one his task, also commanded the doorkeeper to stay awake.

verses.latin: vigilate itaque, nescitis enim quando dominus domus veniat: sero, an media nocte, an galli cantu, an mane:
verses.english: “Therefore, be on the alert—for you do not know when the master of the house is coming, whether in the evening, or at midnight, or at the rooster’s crowing, or in the morning—

verses.latin: ne forte, cum repente venerit, inveniat vos dormientes.
verses.english: lest he come suddenly and find you asleep.

verses.latin: Quod autem vobis dico, omnibus dico: Vigilate.
verses.english: “What I say to you I say to all: ‘Be on the alert!’”

verses.latin: Erat autem Pascha, et Azyma post biduum: et quaerebant summi sacerdotes et scribae, quomodo eum dolo tenerent, et occiderent.
verses.english: The Passover and Unleavened Bread were coming in two days. The chief priests and scribes sought how to seize Jesus by treachery and kill Him.

verses.latin: Dicebant enim: Ne in die festo, ne forte tumultus fiat in populo.
verses.english: They said, “Not during the festival, lest there be a riot among the people.”

verses.latin: Et cum esset in Bethania, in domo Simonis leprosi, et recubuit, venit mulier habens alabastrum unguenti spica nardi puri, pretiosi, et confracto alabastro, misit super caput ejus.
verses.english: Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper, and as He reclined at table, a woman came with an alabaster flask of very costly ointment of pure nard. Breaking the flask, she poured the ointment over His head.

verses.latin: Erant autem quidam, qui indigne ferebant in semetipsis, et dicebant: Ut quid perditio haec unguenti facta est?
verses.english: Some were indignant within themselves and said, “Why was this waste of ointment made?

verses.latin: Potuit enim hoc unguentum venundari pluris quam trecentis denariis, et dari pauperibus. Et fremebant in eam.
verses.english: It could have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and given to the poor.” And they were angry at her.

verses.latin: Jesus autem dixit: Sinite eam: quid ei molestos estis? bonum opus operata est in me.
verses.english: Jesus said, “Let her alone! Why do you bother her? She has done a good work for Me.

verses.latin: Semper enim pauperes habetis vobiscum: et cum volueritis, potestis illis benefacere: me autem non semper habetis.
verses.english: For you always have the poor with you, and whenever you want, you can do good to them. But you do not always have Me.

verses.latin: Quod habuit, fecit: praevenit unguere corpus meum in sepulturam.
verses.english: She has done what she could; she has beforehand anointed My body for burial.

verses.latin: Amen dico vobis: Ubicumque praedicabitur Evangelium hoc in universo mundo, et quod fecit haec, narrabitur in memoriam ejus.
verses.english: Amen, I say to you, wherever the Gospel is proclaimed throughout the whole world, what she has done will be told in memory of her.”

verses.latin: Et Judas Iscariot, unus de duodecim, abiit ad summos sacerdotes, ut ei eum traderet.
verses.english: Then Judas Iscariot, one of the Twelve, went to the chief priests to hand Jesus over to them.

verses.latin: Qui audientes gauisi sunt: et promiserunt ei pecuniam se daturos. Et quaerebat quomodo illum opportune traderet.
verses.english: They were pleased when they heard this and promised to give him money. And he sought how to betray Him at a convenient time.

verses.latin: Et primo die Azymorum, quando Pascha immolabant, dicunt ei discipuli ejus: Ubi vis eamus, et paremus tibi, ut manduces Pascha?
verses.english: On the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread, when they sacrificed the Passover, His disciples said to Him, “Where do you want us to go to prepare for You to eat the Passover?”

verses.latin: Et mittit duos ex discipulis suis, et dicit eis: Ite in civitatem: et occurret vobis homo lagenam aquae portans: sequimini eum.
verses.english: He sent two of His disciples and said to them, “Go into the city, and a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him.

verses.latin: Et quocumque introierit, dicite domino domus: Magister dicit: Ubi est refectio, ubi Pascha manducem cum discipulis meis?
verses.english: Wherever he enters, say to the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says, “Where is the guest room where I may eat the Passover with My disciples?”’

verses.latin: Et ipse vobis ostendet cenaculum magnum stratum: et ibi parate nobis.
verses.english: Then he will show you a large upper room furnished and ready. Prepare for us there.”

verses.latin: Et abierunt discipuli ejus, et venerunt in civitatem: et invenerunt sicut dixit eis, et paraverunt Pascha.
verses.english: The disciples went out and came to the city and found everything as He had told them, and they prepared the Passover.

verses.latin: Vespere autem facto venit cum duodecim.
verses.english: When it was evening, He came with the Twelve.

verses.latin: Et discumbentes, et manducantes, dixit Jesus: Amen dico vobis, quia unus ex vobis tradet me, qui manducat mecum.
verses.english: As they reclined and were eating, Jesus said, “Amen, I say to you, one of you will betray Me, the one eating with Me.”

verses.latin: Coeperunt contristari, et dicere ei singuli: Numquid ego?
verses.english: They began to be sorrowful and to say to Him one by one, “Surely not I?”

verses.latin: Qui respondens, ait illis: Unus ex duodecim, qui intingit mecum in parapside.
verses.english: He said to them in reply, “One of the Twelve, the one who dips his hand into the dish with Me.

verses.latin: Filius quidem hominis vadit, sicut scriptum est de illo: vae autem homini illi, per quem Filius hominis traditur: bonum erat ei, si natus non fuisset homo ille.
verses.english: The Son of Man goes as it is written about Him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed. It would have been better for that man if he had not been born.”

verses.latin: Et manducantes illis, accepit Jesus panem, et benedicens fregit, et dedit eis, et ait: Sumite, hoc est corpus meum.
verses.english: While they were eating, He took bread, said the blessing, broke it, gave it to them, and said, “Take this, this is My body.”

verses.latin: Et accipiens calicem, gratias agens, dedit eis: et biberunt ex eo omnes.
verses.english: Then He took a cup, gave thanks, and gave it to them, and they all drank from it.

verses.latin: Et ait illis: Hic est sanguis meus novi testamenti, qui pro multis effundetur.
verses.english: He said to them, “This is My blood of the covenant, which will be shed for many.

verses.latin: Amen dico vobis, quia jam non bibam de genimine vitis usque in diem illum, cum bibam illud novum in regno Dei.
verses.english: Amen, I say to you, I shall not drink again the fruit of the vine until the day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”

verses.latin: Et hymno dicto, exierunt in montem Oliveti.
verses.english: Then, after singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

verses.latin: Et dicit eis Jesus: Omnes scandalizabimini in me in nocte ista. Scriptum est enim: Percutiam pastorem, et dispergentur oves.
verses.english: Jesus said to them, “You will all have your faith shaken, for it is written: ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.’

verses.latin: Sed postquam resurrexero, praecedam vos in Galilaeam.
verses.english: But after I am raised up, I shall go before you to Galilee.”

verses.latin: Petrus autem ait illi: Et si omnes scandalizati fuerint, sed non ego.
verses.english: Peter said to Him, “Even though all should have their faith shaken, I will not.”

verses.latin: Et dicit ei Jesus: Amen dico tibi, quia hodie in nocte ista, priusquam gallus bis cantet, ter me negabis.
verses.english: Jesus said to him, “Amen, I say to you, this very night before the cock crows twice, you will deny Me three times.”

verses.latin: Ille autem vehementius loquebatur: Etsi oportuerit me mori cum te, non te negabo. Similiter autem et omnes dicebant.
verses.english: But he vehemently protested, “Even though I should have to die with You, I will not deny You.” And they all spoke similarly.

verses.latin: Et veniunt in villam, cui nomen Gethsemani. Et dicit discipulis suis: Sedete hic, donec orem.
verses.english: They came to a place named Gethsemane, and He said to His disciples, “Sit here while I pray.”

verses.latin: Et assumit Petrum, et Jacobum, et Joannem secum: et coepit pavere, et tædere.
verses.english: He took with Him Peter, James, and John, and began to be troubled and distressed.

verses.latin: Et dicit eis: Tristis est anima mea usque ad mortem: sustinete hic, et vigilate.
verses.english: He said to them, “My soul is sorrowful even to death. Remain here and keep watch.”

verses.latin: Et cum processisset paululum, procidit super terram: et orabat, ut si fieri posset, transiret ab eo hora.
verses.english: He advanced a little and fell to the ground and prayed that if it were possible, the hour might pass Him.

verses.latin: Et dicebat: Abba, Pater: omnia tibi possibilia sunt: transfer calicem istum a me: sed non quod ego volo, sed quod tu.
verses.english: He said, “Abba, Father, all things are possible to You. Take this cup away from Me, but not what I will, but what You will.”

verses.latin: Et venit, et invenit eos dormientes: et dicit Petro: Simon, dormis? non potuisti una hora vigilare?
verses.english: Then He returned and found them sleeping. He said to Peter, “Simon, are you asleep? Could you not keep watch for one hour?

verses.latin: Vigilate, et orate, ut non intretis in tentationem. Spiritus quidem promptus, caro autem infirma.
verses.english: Keep watch and pray that you may not undergo the test. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”

verses.latin: Et iterum abiens, oravit, eundem sermonem dicens.
verses.english: Again He went away and prayed, saying the same thing.

verses.latin: Et reversus, iterum invenit eos dormientes: erant enim oculi eorum gravati: et ignorabant quid responderent ei.
verses.english: Again He returned and found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy, and they did not know what to answer Him.

verses.latin: Et venit tertio, et dicit eis: Dormite jam, et requiescite: sufficit: venit hora: ecce traditur Filius hominis in manus peccatorum.
verses.english: He returned a third time and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and taking your rest? It is over. The hour has come. Behold, the Son of Man is to be handed over to sinners.

verses.latin: Surgite, eamus: ecce, qui tradit me, prope est.
verses.english: Get up, let us go. See, My betrayer is near.”

verses.latin: Et statim, eo adhuc loquente, venit Judas Iscariot, unus ex duodecim, et cum illo turba cum gladiis et fustibus, missa a summis sacerdotibus, et scribis, et senioribus.
verses.english: Immediately, while He was still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, arrived, accompanied by a crowd with swords and clubs, sent by the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders.

verses.latin: Dederat autem illis qui traderet eum, signum, dicens: Quem osculatus fuero, ipse est: tenete eum, et ducite caute.
verses.english: The one who was to hand Him over had given them a sign, saying, “Whomever I shall kiss is the one; seize him and lead him away securely.”

verses.latin: Et cum venisset, statim accedens ad eum, dicit: Rabbi: et osculatus est eum.
verses.english: And when he came, he immediately went up to Him and said, “Rabbi,” and kissed Him.

verses.latin: At illi manus injecerunt in eum.
verses.english: Then they laid hands on Him.

verses.latin: Unus autem ex circumstantibus, evaginato gladio, percussit servum summi sacerdotis, et amputavit illi aurum.
verses.english: One of the bystanders drew his sword, struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.

verses.latin: Et respondens Jesus, ait illis: Tamquam ad latronem existis cum gladiis et fustibus, comprehendere me?
verses.english: Jesus said to them in reply, “Have you come out as against a robber, with swords and clubs, to seize Me?

verses.latin: Quotidie eram vobiscum in templo docens, et non me tenuistis. Sed ut impleantur Scripturae.
verses.english: Day after day I was with you in the temple teaching, and you did not arrest Me; but that the Scriptures may be fulfilled.”

verses.latin: Tunc, relicto eo, fugerunt omnes.
verses.english: And they all left Him and fled.

verses.latin: Et adolescens quidam sequebatur eum, amictus sindone super nudum: et tenuerunt eum.
verses.english: Now a young man followed Him, wearing nothing but a linen cloth about his body. They tried to seize him,

verses.latin: At ille, rejecta sindone, nudus aufugit ab eis.
verses.english: but he left the linen cloth behind and ran off naked.

verses.latin: Et adduxerunt Jesum ad summum sacerdotem: et convenerunt omnes summi sacerdotes et seniores et scribae.
verses.english: They led Jesus away to the high priest, and all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes came together.

verses.latin: Petrus autem a longe sequebatur eum usque intro in atrium summi sacerdotis: et sedebat cum ministris, et calefiebat ad ignem.
verses.english: Peter followed Him at a distance, right into the high priest's courtyard, where he sat with the guards and warmed himself by the fire.

verses.latin: Summi autem sacerdotes, et omnis concilium, quaerebant contra Jesum testimonium ut eum morti traderent: et non inveniebant.
verses.english: The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were seeking testimony against Jesus so they could put Him to death, but they found none.

verses.latin: Multi enim falso testimonium dicebant contra eum, et similes erant testimonia.
verses.english: Many gave false testimony against Him, but their testimonies did not agree.

verses.latin: Et quidam, surgentes, falso testimonium dicebant adversus eum, dicentes:
verses.english: Some began to give false testimony against Him, saying,

verses.latin: Nos audivimus eum dicentem: Quia ego dissolvam templum hoc manufactum, et post triduum aliud non manufactum aedificabo.
verses.english: “We heard Him say, ‘I will destroy this temple made with hands and within three days I will build another not made with hands.’”

verses.latin: Et non erat par testimonium illorum.
verses.english: But not even so did their testimony agree.

verses.latin: Et surgens summus sacerdos, in medium, interrogavit Jesum, dicens: Non respondes quid ista contra te testificantur?
verses.english: The high priest rose before them and questioned Jesus, saying, “Have you no answer? What are these men testifying against you?”

verses.latin: Qui tacebat, et nihil respondit. Iterum summus sacerdos interrogabat eum, et dicit ei: Tu es Christus filius benedicti?
verses.english: But He remained silent and answered nothing. Again the high priest questioned Him and said to Him, “Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed One?”

verses.latin: Jesus autem dixit: Ego sum: et videbitis Filium hominis a dextris sedentem virtutis, et venientem cum nubibus caeli.
verses.english: Jesus said, “I AM; and you will see the Son of Man seated at the right hand of the Power and coming with the clouds of the sky.”

verses.latin: At summus sacerdos, scindens vestimenta sua, ait: Quid adhuc desideramus testimonium?
verses.english: The high priest tore his garments and said, “What further need have we of witnesses?

verses.latin: Audistis blasphemiam: quid vobis videtur? Qui omnes judicaverunt eum reum esse mortis.
verses.english: You have heard the blasphemy. What do you think?” They all condemned Him as deserving to die.

verses.latin: Et coeperunt quidam conspuere eum, et velare faciem ejus, et colaphis eum caedere, et dicere ei: Prophetiza.
verses.english: Some began to spit on Him. They blindfolded Him and began to beat Him, and to say to Him, “Prophesy!”

verses.latin: Et ministri colaphis eum caedebant.
verses.english: The guards also took Him and beat Him.

verses.latin: Et cum esset Petrus in inferius in atrio, venit una ex ancillis summi sacerdotis:
verses.english: While Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the high priest’s maids came.

verses.latin: et videns Petrum calentem, aspexit illum, et ait: Et tu cum Jesu Nazareno eras.
verses.english: Seeing Peter warming himself, she looked intently at him and said, “You too were with Jesus of Nazareth.”

verses.latin: Ille autem negavit, dicens: Nescio, neque scio quid dicis. Et exiit foras ante curtim: et gallus cantavit.
verses.english: But he denied it, saying, “I neither know nor understand what you are saying.” And he went out to the forecourt, and the cock crowed.

verses.latin: Et iterum ancilla, videns eum, coepit dicere circumstantibus: Quia hic de illis est.
verses.english: The maid saw him and began again to say to the bystanders, “This man is one of them.”

verses.latin: Ille autem iterum negabat. Et post pusillum, iterum qui assistebant, dicebant Petro: Vere tu ex illis es: nam et Galilaeus es.
verses.english: He again denied it. After a little while the bystanders again said to Peter, “Surely you are one of them; for you are a Galilean.”

verses.latin: Ille autem coepit anathematizare, et jurare: Quia nescio hominem istum quem vos dicitis.
verses.english: He began to curse and to swear, “I do not know this man about whom you are speaking.”

verses.latin: Et statim secundo gallus cantavit. Et recordatus est Petrus verbi, quod dixit ei Jesus: Priusquam gallus bis cantet, ter me negabis: et coepit flere.
verses.english: Immediately the cock crowed a second time. Peter remembered the word that Jesus had said to him, “Before the cock crows twice, you will deny Me three times.” And he broke down and wept.

verses.latin: Et statim mane consilium facientes summi sacerdotes cum senioribus et scribis et universo concilio, vincentes Jesum, duxerunt eum, et tradiderunt Pilato.
verses.english: Early in the morning, the high priests, elders, scribes, and the entire council made a plan. They bound Jesus, brought Him, and handed Him over to Pilate.

verses.latin: Et interrogavit eum Pilatus: Tu es rex Judaeorum? At ille respondens ait illi: Tu dicis.
verses.english: Pilate questioned Him, asking: “Are you the king of the Jews?” He replied: “You say so.”

verses.latin: Et accusabant eum multi, et multa.
verses.english: And many accused Him of many things.

verses.latin: Pilatus autem iterum interrogavit eum, dicens: Non respondes quidquam? vides in quantis te accusant?
verses.english: Pilate questioned Him again, saying: “Won’t you answer? See how many things they are accusing you of?”

verses.latin: Jesus autem amplius nihil respondit, ita ut miraretur Pilatus.
verses.english: But Jesus still did not reply, so Pilate was amazed.

verses.latin: Per diem autem festum dimittebat illis unum ex vinctis, quemcumque postularent.
verses.english: Now, it was customary for him to release one prisoner at the feast, whomever they requested.

verses.latin: Erat autem qui dicebatur Barabbas, qui cum seditiosis erat vinctus, qui in seditione fecerant homicidium.
verses.english: There was a man called Barabbas, who was imprisoned with those who had started a revolt and committed murder during the revolt.

verses.latin: Et cum ascendisset turba, coepit rogare, ut faceret eis sicut semper faciebat illis.
verses.english: The crowd then came up and began to request that he do for them what he always did.

verses.latin: Pilatus autem respondit eis, dicens: Vultis dimittam vobis regem Judaeorum?
verses.english: Pilate answered them, saying: “Do you want me to release for you the king of the Jews?”

verses.latin: Sciebat enim quod per invidiam tradidissent eum summi sacerdotes.
verses.english: For he knew that the high priests had handed Him over out of envy.

verses.latin: Pontifices autem concitaverunt turbam, ut magis Barabbam dimitteret eis.
verses.english: The high priests stirred up the crowd so that he would release Barabbas for them instead.

verses.latin: Pilatus iterum respondens, ait illis: Quid ergo vultis faciam regi Judaeorum?
verses.english: Pilate answered them again, saying: “Then what do you want me to do with the king of the Jews?”

verses.latin: At illi iterum clamaverunt: Crucifige eum.
verses.english: They shouted back: “Crucify him!”

verses.latin: Pilatus autem dicebat eis: Quid enim mali fecit? At illi magis clamabant: Crucifige eum.
verses.english: Pilate said to them: “Why, what wrong has he done?” But they shouted all the louder: “Crucify him!”

verses.latin: Pilatus, volens satisfacere turbae, dimisit illis Barabbam, et tradidit Jesum flagellis, ut crucifigeretur.
verses.english: Pilate, wanting to satisfy the crowd, released Barabbas for them and handed Jesus over to be scourged and crucified.

verses.latin: Milites autem duxerunt eum intro in atrium praetorii: et convocant totam cohortem.
verses.english: The soldiers then brought Him into the courtyard, that is, the praetorium, and called together the entire cohort.

verses.latin: Et induunt eum purpuram, et inponunt ei plectentes spineam coronam.
verses.english: They put a purple cloak on Him, and twisted a crown of thorns and placed it on Him.

verses.latin: Et coeperunt salutare eum: Ave, rex Judaeorum.
verses.english: Then they began to salute Him: “Hail, king of the Jews!”

verses.latin: Et percutiebant caput ejus arundine: et conspuebant eum: et ponentes genua adorabant eum.
verses.english: And they struck Him on the head with a reed. They spat on Him, and bowing their knees, they worshipped Him.

verses.latin: Et postquam illuserunt ei, exuerunt eum purpuram, et induerunt eum vestimentis suis: et eduxerunt eum ut crucifigerent eum.
verses.english: After mocking Him, they took the purple cloak off Him and put His own clothes back on. Then they led Him out to crucify Him.

verses.latin: Et angariaverunt praetereuntem quempiam, Simonem Cyrenaeum, venientem de villa, patrem Alexandri et Rufi, ut tolleret crucem ejus.
verses.english: They compelled a certain passer-by, Simon of Cyrene, who was coming from the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to carry His cross.

verses.latin: Et adducunt eum in Golgotha locum, quod est interpretatum Calvariae locus.
verses.english: They brought Him to the place Golgotha, which means, the place of the skull.

verses.latin: Et dabant ei vinum, myrrha mixtum: sed non accepit.
verses.english: They offered Him wine mixed with myrrh, but He didn’t take it.

verses.latin: Et crucifigunt eum: et dividunt vestimenta ejus, mittentes sortem super ea, quis quid tolleret.
verses.english: And they crucified Him, and divided His garments among them, casting lots for them to see what each one would take.

verses.latin: Erat autem hora tertia, et crucifixerunt eum.
verses.english: It was the third hour when they crucified Him.

verses.latin: Et erat titulus causae ejus inscriptus: Rex Judaeorum.
verses.english: The inscription of the charge against Him was written: “The King of the Jews.”

verses.latin: Et cum eo crucifigunt duos latrones: unum a dextris, et alium a sinistris ejus.
verses.english: With Him, they crucified two thieves, one on His right and the other on His left.

verses.latin: Et adimpleta est Scriptura, quae dicit: Et cum iniquis reputatus est.
verses.english: And the Scripture was fulfilled which says, “And he was counted among the wicked.”

verses.latin: Et praetereuntes blasphemabant eum, moventes capita sua, et dicentes: Vah, qui destruis templum, et in tribus diebus aedificas:
verses.english: Those who passed by blasphemed Him, shaking their heads and saying, “Aha! You who destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days,

verses.latin: salvum fac teipsum, descendens de cruce.
verses.english: save yourself by coming down from the cross!”

verses.latin: Similiter et summi sacerdotes illudentes, inter se cum scribis dicebant: Alios salvos fecit, seipsum non potest salvum facere.
verses.english: In the same way, the high priests mocked Him among themselves with the scribes, saying, “He saved others; He can’t save Himself.”

verses.latin: Christus rex Israel, descendat nunc de cruce, ut videamus et credamus. Et qui cum eo crucifixerant, improperabant ei.
verses.english: “Let Christ, the king of Israel, come down now from the cross, so that we may see and believe.” Even those who were crucified with Him reviled Him.

verses.latin: Et facta hora sexta, tenebrae factae sunt per totam terram usque in horam nonam.
verses.english: When the sixth hour came, darkness fell over the whole earth until the ninth hour.

verses.latin: Et hora nona exclamavit Jesus voce magna, dicens: Eloi, Eloi, lama sabacthani? quod est interpretatum: Deus meus, Deus meus, ut quid dereliquisti me?
verses.english: At the ninth hour, Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?” which means, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”

verses.latin: Et quidam de circumstantibus audientes, dicebant: Ecce, Eliam vocat.
verses.english: Some of the bystanders, hearing this, said: “Look, he’s calling for Elijah.”

verses.latin: Currens autem unus, et implens spongiam aceto, circumposuit calamo, et potum dabat ei, dicens: Sinite, videamus si veniat Elias ad deponendum eum.
verses.english: Someone ran and filled a sponge with vinegar, put it on a reed, and offered it to Him to drink, saying, “Wait! Let us see if Elijah comes to take Him down.”

verses.latin: Jesus autem emissa voce magna exspiravit.
verses.english: Then Jesus, uttering a loud cry, breathed His last.

verses.latin: Et velum templi scissum est in duo, a summo usque deorsum.
verses.english: And the veil of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.

verses.latin: Videns autem centurio, qui ex adverso stabat, quia sic clamans exspirasset, ait: Vere homo hic Filius Dei erat.
verses.english: When the centurion who stood facing Him saw that He had breathed His last in this way, he said, “Truly this man was the Son of God.”

verses.latin: Erant autem et mulieres de longe aspicientes: inter quas erat Maria Magdalene, et Maria Jacobi minoris, et Joses mater, et Salome:
verses.english: There were also women looking on from a distance, among whom were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joses, and Salome.

verses.latin: qui cum esset in Galilaea, sequebantur eum, et ministrabant ei, et aliae multae, quae simul cum eo ascenderant Jerosolymam.
verses.english: They had followed Him when He was in Galilee, ministering to Him, and there were many other women who had come up with Him to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et cum jam sero esset factum, quia erat parasceve, quod est ante sabbatum,
verses.english: When evening had come, because it was the Preparation Day, that is, the day before the Sabbath,

verses.latin: venit Joseph ab Arimathaea, nobilis decurio, qui et ipse erat exspectans regnum Dei: et ausus est introire ad Pilatum, et petiit corpus Jesu.
verses.english: Joseph of Arimathaea, a respected member of the council, who was also waiting for the kingdom of God, took courage and went to Pilate to ask for the body of Jesus.

verses.latin: Pilatus autem mirabatur si jam obiisset: et accersito centurione, interrogavit eum si jam mortuus esset.
verses.english: Pilate was surprised that He was already dead, and summoning the centurion, he asked him if He was already dead.

verses.latin: Et cum cognovisset a centurione, donavit corpus Joseph.
verses.english: When he learned this from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph.

verses.latin: Joseph autem mercatus sindonem, et deponens eum involvit in sindone, et posuit eum in monumento, quod erat excisum de petra: et advolvit lapidem ad ostium monumenti.
verses.english: Having bought a linen shroud, Joseph took Him down, wrapped Him in the linen, and laid Him in a tomb that had been cut out of the rock. Then he rolled a stone against the entrance of the tomb.

verses.latin: Maria autem Magdalene, et Maria Joses aspiciebant ubi poneretur.
verses.english: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses were looking on where He was laid.

verses.latin: Et consummato sabbato, Maria Magdalene, et Maria Iacobi, et Salome emerunt aromata, ut venientes ungerent Jesum.
verses.english: After the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought perfumed oils, so that when they came to the tomb, they could anoint Jesus.

verses.latin: Et valde mane una sabbati, veniunt ad monumentum, orto jam sole.
verses.english: And very early on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb. The sun had just risen.

verses.latin: Et dicebant ad invicem: Quis revolvet nobis lapidem ab ostio monumenti?
verses.english: And they were saying to one another: "Who will roll away the stone from the entrance of the tomb?"

verses.latin: Et respicientes viderunt revolutum lapidem. Erat quippe magnus valde.
verses.english: But looking up, they saw that the stone had been rolled away. It was very large.

verses.latin: Et introëuntes in monumentum, viderunt juvenem sedentem in dextris, indutum stola candida, et obstupuerunt.
verses.english: And entering into the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right, wearing a white robe, and they were astonished.

verses.latin: Qui dicit eis: Nolite expavescere: Jesum quaeritis Nazarenum crucifixum: resurrexit, non est hic, ecce locus ubi posuerunt eum.
verses.english: The young man said to them: "Do not be terrified. You are seeking Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He has risen; He is not here. See the place where they laid Him.

verses.latin: Sed ite, dicite discipulis ejus, et Petro, quia praecedet vos in Galilaeam: ibi eum videbitis, sicut dixit vobis.
verses.english: But go, tell His disciples and Peter, that He goes before you into Galilee. There you will see Him, as He said to you."

verses.latin: Et exientes, fugerunt de monumento: habebat enim illas tremor et pavor: nec cui, quid dicerent, dixerunt: timebant enim.
verses.english: And they went out and fled from the tomb, for trembling and fear had seized them. And they said nothing to anyone, for they were afraid.

verses.latin: Resurgens autem mane prima sabbati, apparuit primo Mariae Magdalene, de qua ejecerat septem daemonia.
verses.english: Now when Jesus rose early on the first day of the week, He appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom He had cast out seven demons.

verses.latin: Haec illa, iens nuntiavit his qui cum eo fuerant, qui maerebant et flebant.
verses.english: She went and announced the news to those who had been with Him, who were mourning and weeping.

verses.latin: Et illi audientes quia viveret, et visus esset ab ea, non crediderunt.
verses.english: And when they heard that He was alive and had been seen by her, they did not believe.

verses.latin: Post haec autem duobus ex illis ambulantibus, ostensus est in alia effigie, euntibus in vicum.
verses.english: After this, He appeared in a different form to two of them while they were walking to the country.

verses.latin: Et illi euntes nuntiaverunt ceteris: nec illis crediderunt.
verses.english: And they went and told the others, and they did not believe them.

verses.latin: Novissime autem recumbentibus illis undecim, apparuit: et increpavit incredulitatem eorum et duritiam cordis, quia his qui viderant eum resurgentem, non crediderunt.
verses.english: Finally, as they were reclining at table, He appeared to the eleven. And He rebuked their unbelief and hardness of heart because they had not believed those who saw Him after He had risen.

verses.latin: Et dixit eis: Euntes in mundum universum, praedicate Evangelium omni creaturae.
verses.english: And He said to them: "Go into the entire world and preach the Gospel to every creature.

verses.latin: Qui crediderit et baptizatus fuerit, salvus erit: qui vero non crediderit, condemnabitur.
verses.english: Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.

verses.latin: Signa autem eos qui crediderint, haec sequentur: in nomine meo daemonia ejicient: linguis loquentur novis:
verses.english: And these signs will accompany those who believe: In My name they will cast out demons; they will speak in new tongues;

verses.latin: serpentes tollent: et si mortiferum quid biberint, non eis nocebit: super aegrotos manus imponent, et bene habebunt.
verses.english: they will pick up serpents, and if they drink any deadly thing, it will not harm them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will recover."

verses.latin: Dominus quidem postquam locutus est eis, assumptus est in caelum, et sedet ad dexteram Dei.
verses.english: So then, after the Lord had spoken to them, He was taken up into the sky and sat at the right hand of God.

verses.latin: Illi autem profecti praedicaverunt ubique: Domino cooperante, et sermonem confirmante sequentibus signis.
verses.english: And they went forth and preached everywhere, while the Lord worked with them and confirmed the word by the signs that followed.
